title: Cold Email Campaign Manager (High-Volume B2B Outreach)
description:
About Us



We are a fast-growing B2B lead generation agency that helps professional service firms (insurance agencies, law firms, IT companies, financial advisors, and property maintenance companies) fill their pipeline with qualified prospects. We send high-volume, hyper-personalized cold
 campaigns across multiple industries and we need someone who can own the entire
 operation from list building to lead delivery.



This is not a "send 500
s a week" role. We operate at scale — tens of thousands of
s per day across hundreds of inboxes. If you have never managed infrastructure at this level, this role is not for you. If you have, keep reading.



What You Will Do Every Day



Campaign Operations (60% of your time)



You will manage the end-to-end cold
 process for multiple clients across different industries. This includes building targeted lead lists using B2B data platforms, writing and loading
 sequences into the sending platform, scheduling campaigns across rotating inboxes, and monitoring deliverability metrics (open rates, bounce rates, spam complaints) daily. You will manage 100+ sending inboxes and ensure every one stays healthy.



Deliverability Management (20% of your time)



You will own inbox warming, domain health, and sender reputation across all accounts. This means monitoring inbox placement rates, rotating underperforming domains, managing DNS authentication records (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), and proactively pausing or replacing inboxes before they damage the overall sending reputation. You will run deliverability tests weekly and report results.



Lead Processing & Delivery (10% of your time)



When prospects reply, you will categorize responses (interested, maybe later, not interested, out of office, wrong person) and deliver qualified warm leads to clients via Google Sheets or CRM. Speed matters — warm leads must be delivered within 2 hours of reply during business hours.



Reporting & Optimization (10% of your time)



You will maintain a weekly performance dashboard for each client showing
s sent, open rates, reply rates, positive reply rates, and meetings booked. You will run A/B tests on subject lines, opening lines, and CTAs, and make data-driven recommendations to improve performance.









Required Experience & Skills



You must have hands-on experience with at least two of the following cold
 sending platforms: Smartlead, Instantly, Lemlist, Woodpecker, or Mailshake. You should be comfortable managing campaigns with 50+ active sending accounts simultaneously.



You must understand
 deliverability at a technical level — not just "warm up your inbox" but the actual mechanics of SPF/DKIM/DMARC configuration, inbox rotation strategies, and how to diagnose and fix deliverability drops.



You must have experience with B2B lead data platforms for building targeted prospect lists. You should know how to filter by industry, company size, job title, geography, and other criteria to build high-quality lists that match a client's ideal customer profile.



You must be proficient in Google Sheets (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, data cleanup formulas) since this is how we track leads and report to clients.



Strong written English is required. You will be writing and editing
 copy that goes to American business owners — it must sound natural, not templated.









Preferred (Bonus) Skills



Experience with Clay or similar data enrichment tools for adding personalization layers to lead lists. Experience using AI (ChatGPT, Claude) to generate personalized
 icebreakers at scale. Familiarity with Google Workspace admin for managing multiple inboxes. Experience with Zapier, Make, or n8n for workflow automation between platforms.









How to Apply



In your application, answer these four questions:



1.

What is the largest number of sending inboxes you have managed at one time, and what sending platform were you using?



2.

Describe a time when your
 deliverability dropped significantly. What caused it and how did you fix it?



3.

What is your process for building a lead list of 10,000 business owners in a specific industry and geography?



4.

Show me an example of a hyper-personalized cold
 you wrote (or generated with AI). What data points did you use to personalize it, and where did you get that data? If you cannot share a real example, write one right now for a fictional insurance agency owner named Mike Thompson who runs a 12-person agency in Dallas, TX.



Do not send a generic cover letter. Applications that do not answer these four questions will not be reviewed.

title: Real Estate Virtual Assistant
description:
We are looking for a motivated individual who is passionate about success and personal growth to join our team as a Virtual Assistant/Executive Assistant. This role is ideal for someone confident, proactive, and eager to take initiative to help move the team forward. If you’re a team player who enjoys helping others grow while growing yourself, keep reading.



The right candidate brings a positive, “take-charge” attitude and a solutions-oriented mindset. You can think quickly, adapt when things don’t go as planned, and still value structured systems and consistency. You appreciate accountability because you see it as a tool for reaching your potential. Strong communication skills—being able to clearly express thoughts, needs, and goals—are essential.



At your core, you have a servant-leadership mindset and believe in earning opportunities through contribution, reliability, and results. You are naturally curious and take ownership of your development, seeking out new skills through books, trainings, videos, and classes without needing to be told.



Core Duties & Responsibilities



1. Support the Team Leader

Learn the Team Leader’s schedule, priorities, and work style. Create an environment that supports productivity by managing, delegating, or minimizing distractions.



2. CRM & Database Management

Maintain a large client and prospect database (CRM) with clear, accurate, and up-to-date notes and records.



3. Lead Follow-Up & Communication

Contact potential clients via phone, text, and
. Maintain consistent follow-up to qualify and nurture leads.



4. Systems & Process Implementation

Help develop and implement processes for buyers, sellers, lead generation, database management, and transaction support. Monitor systems and suggest improvements when needed.



5. Operations Manual Management

Create and maintain an operations manual documenting systems, workflows, and standards.



6. Tracking & Reporting

Track, measure, and report activities and key metrics (calls made, leads generated, contracts, etc.) so the team can adjust and stay on pace for goals.



7. Agent Support

Assist multiple agents with managing contacts, responding to client inquiries, scheduling appointments, and maintaining follow-up systems.



8. Marketing Support

Assist with
 marketing, social media posts, and simple video or content coordination.



9. Transaction Coordination Support

Help coordinate pending transactions and client communication throughout the process.



10. Event Coordination

Assist in planning and coordinating client and prospect events.

title: Full-Stack AI Automation Architect
description:
About Us



We are a growing agency that helps businesses automate everything — lead generation, marketing, client onboarding, internal operations, content creation, and more. We work with law firms, insurance agencies, financial advisors, IT companies, and other professional service businesses. Our edge is that we do not just offer one service. We look at a business, identify every process that is repetitive, manual, or slow, and we build AI-powered systems that handle it automatically.



We need someone who thinks in systems. Someone who hears "I spend 3 hours a day doing X" and immediately knows how to make it happen in 3 minutes. Someone who is obsessed with connecting tools, building workflows, and using AI to eliminate busywork across every part of a business.



This is not a "set up a Zapier zap" role. We build complex, multi-step, AI-driven automation systems that run entire business operations. If you have only built simple two-step automations, this role is not for you. If you have built systems that made people ask "how the hell does this work?" — keep reading.



What You Will Do



Your job is to look at any business process — ours or our clients' — and figure out how to automate it. The scope is broad on purpose. Here are the categories of work you will own:



AI-Powered Business Automation (40% of your time)



You will design and build automated systems that replace manual work across every part of our business and our clients' businesses. This includes but is not limited to:



•

Lead generation pipelines: Automated scraping, enrichment, AI-powered hyper-personalization, and campaign deployment — so leads flow in without anyone touching a spreadsheet.



•

Client onboarding workflows: When a new client signs up, automated sequences that collect their information, set up their accounts, send welcome materials, and schedule kickoff calls — without a human doing any of it.



•

CRM and pipeline management: Automated lead categorization, follow-up scheduling, deal stage updates, and alert systems that notify the right person at the right time.



•

Document and proposal generation: AI-powered systems that take client data and automatically generate custom proposals, reports, or deliverables.



•

Internal operations: Automated reporting dashboards, task assignment systems, performance tracking, and anything else that currently requires someone to manually update a spreadsheet or send a Slack message.



You will use whatever tools the job requires — Make (Integromat), n8n, Zapier, custom Python/Node.js scripts, Google Apps Script, or direct API integrations. You pick the right tool for the job.



AI Content & Social Media Automation (25% of your time)



You will build and manage automated content creation and distribution systems. This includes:



•

Automated video generation: Using platforms like HeyGen, Synthesia, Pictory, or similar tools to generate AI avatar videos, repurpose long-form content into short clips, and produce video content at scale without a production team.



•

Social media scheduling and posting: Building automated pipelines that generate social media content using AI (captions, hashtags, image selection), schedule posts across multiple platforms, and adapt content format for each channel (LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok,
, X).



•

Content repurposing engines: Systems that take one piece of content (a blog post, a podcast episode, a video) and automatically break it into 10-20 pieces of social content — different formats, different platforms, different angles — all generated and scheduled without manual work.



•

AI-powered copywriting pipelines: Automated systems that generate blog posts,
 newsletters, ad copy, and landing page content using AI, with human review checkpoints built into the workflow.



You should be familiar with tools like Buffer, Hootsuite, or Later for scheduling, and AI video tools like HeyGen, Pictory, or Opus Clip for automated video creation. If you have experience with Canva API or similar design automation, even better.



Client-Facing Automation Solutions (20% of your time)



This is where it gets interesting. We sell automation services to our clients — law firms, insurance agencies, financial advisors, and other businesses. You will build custom automation solutions that we deliver as a product. Examples:



•

A law firm that manually tracks case deadlines ? you build an automated system that pulls court dates, sends reminders to attorneys, and escalates overdue items.



•

An insurance agency that manually sends renewal reminders ? you build an automated pipeline that identifies upcoming renewals, generates personalized outreach, and tracks responses.



•

A financial advisor that manually creates quarterly reports ? you build a system that pulls portfolio data, generates AI-written commentary, and produces branded PDF reports automatically.



•

A property management company that manually coordinates maintenance requests ? you build a system that receives requests, categorizes urgency with AI, dispatches vendors, and sends status updates to tenants.



The point is: you will constantly be solving new problems for new types of businesses. You need to be the kind of person who gets excited when someone describes a manual process, because you already see how to automate it.



Proactive Problem-Solving & Innovation (10% of your time)



This is the most important part of the job description. We want you to constantly ask us what we are doing manually and tell us how to automate it. If you see us doing something by hand, we expect you to come to us and say "I can build something that does that in 10 seconds." We want you to be so good at this that we start to wonder what we even do all day because you have automated everything.



You will also stay current on new AI tools, automation platforms, and integration possibilities. When a new tool launches that could save us time or money, you bring it to us. When a client mentions a pain point in a call, you are already thinking about the workflow that solves it.



Documentation & Maintenance (5% of your time — but always on)



You will document every automation you build — what it does, how it works, what triggers it, and how to troubleshoot it. When something breaks, you fix it fast. You will also build monitoring systems that alert you before things break.









Required Experience & Skills



Advanced automation platform experience is non-negotiable. You must have proven experience building complex, multi-step automations using at least two of the following: Make (Integromat), n8n, Zapier, or custom Python/Node.js scripts with API integrations. "Complex" means 10+ steps, multiple conditional branches, error handling, and integrations with 3+ different platforms in a single workflow. You should be able to show examples.



You must be an API expert. Reading documentation, authenticating (OAuth, API keys, Bearer tokens), making requests, parsing JSON responses, handling pagination, managing rate limits, and building retry logic. If a tool has an API, you should be able to connect it to anything else within hours, not days.



You must have deep experience with AI/LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, or similar). This goes beyond basic prompting. You should understand structured output formats (JSON mode), function calling, prompt chaining, context window management, and how to build quality control layers that catch bad AI output before it reaches a customer. You will use AI as a core component in almost every automation you build.



You must have experience with AI-powered content and video generation tools. This includes platforms like HeyGen, Synthesia, Pictory, Opus Clip, or similar for automated video creation, and experience integrating these tools into larger automated workflows via their APIs.



You must be proficient with Google Workspace automation — Google Sheets, Google Apps Script, Google Drive API, and Gmail API. A huge amount of our work flows through Google products, and you need to be able to build sophisticated automations within that ecosystem.



You must think like a consultant, not just a technician. When someone describes a business problem, you should immediately start mapping out the automation architecture in your head. You do not wait to be told what to build — you identify opportunities and propose solutions.



Strong English communication is required. You will be on calls with clients explaining what you built and why. You need to be able to translate technical automation concepts into simple business language.









Preferred (Bonus) Skills



Experience with cold
 platforms (Smartlead, Instantly) and their APIs. Experience with CRM platforms (HubSpot, GoHighLevel, Salesforce) and their automation capabilities. Experience with webhook-based event processing and real-time data pipelines. Familiarity with cloud functions (AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions) or similar serverless environments. Experience building Slack/
 bots or notification systems. Experience with web scraping (Apify, Puppeteer, BeautifulSoup). Experience with database design and management (Airtable, Supabase, Firebase, or SQL). Experience building client-facing dashboards or reporting tools. Knowledge of social media APIs (Meta, LinkedIn, TikTok, X).



How to Apply



In your application, answer these five questions:



1.

Describe the most complex automation system you have ever built. What business problem did it solve, what tools did it connect, how many steps were involved, and what was the measurable impact (time saved, revenue generated, errors eliminated)?



2.

A law firm tells you they spend 5 hours per week manually sending follow-up
s to leads who filled out a contact form on their website. Walk me through exactly how you would automate this end-to-end, including which tools you would use and why.



3.

Have you built any automated content creation or video generation systems? If yes, describe what you built, what AI tools you used, and how the content was distributed. If no, describe how you would approach building an automated system that takes one 30-minute podcast episode and turns it into 15 social media posts across 4 platforms.



4.

Show me a Loom video (preferred) or detailed screenshot walkthrough of an automation you built that is currently running in production. Walk me through the logic, the tools, and how you handle errors.



5.

What is the most creative automation you have ever built or seen? Something that made you think "that is genius." Describe it and explain why it impressed you.



Do not send a generic cover letter. Applications that do not answer all five questions will not be reviewed.

Support advocacy seeding and positive brand mentions.



4. UGC & Content Operations Specialist

Harvest, tag, and manage UGC across TikTok, IG, YouTube.

Handle rights approvals, licensing workflows, and asset storage.

Support Content Creator with cross-channel repurposing.



5. Ambassador Manager

Recruit, onboard, and manage brand ambassadors.

Coordinate content briefs, review submissions, and track deliverables.

Build strong community relationships and ensure ambassador activity aligns with marketing goals.



What You’ll Do

Work inside a SOP-driven system (no guesswork, every task has a playbook).

Use tools: Asana, Slack, Canva, Klaviyo, Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads Manager, Amazon Seller Central.

Collaborate daily with the AU Marketing Manager and cross-functional teams.

Focus on measurable outputs — clear KPIs, checklists, and reporting.



What We’re Looking For

Strong written English and communication skills.

High attention to detail — accuracy is critical.

Experience in at least one of the role areas (ads, engagement, UGC, ambassadors, marketplaces, influencers).

Proactive, organised, and eager to learn.

Work 9 to 5 PHT. Our office is in Perth, Australia GMT+8



What We Offer

Stable, long-term remote role with career progression.

Competitive PH salary package + 13th month pay + holidays.

Fully documented training

Work with a global brand across AU, NZ, and UK.

Work with an established PH based team.



How to Apply

Send your CV + short cover letter.

Include a relevant work sample (TikTok/Reel, ad copy/design, dashboard/report, or marketplace listing).

Apply via OnlineJobs.ph with subject line:

“Marketing Team – [Role You’re Applying For]”

title: Amazon E-commerce Creative Lead (Graphic Designer & Video Editor)
description:
We are hiring a full-time Amazon Creative Lead to support an e-commerce brand that sells on primarily on Amazon and secondary on Shopify.  



This role combines graphic design, video editing, Amazon listing creatives, website creatives, and related ecommerce design.  





PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:  

- Amazon listing items (Gallery, A+ Content, Brand Story, Video)  

- Amazon A/B testing and experiments 



SUPPORT RESPONSIBILITES:  

- Update Website/Shopify creative assets  

- Short Form Content Video editing for galleries & A+ and socials

- Creative Content Curation for Social Media  

- Video and Still Ad creatives for PPC and paid media  

- Advanced photo manipulation  

- Other Creative Work as required



Workload will vary depending on business needs. Some weeks are heavier/lighter than others. Consistent output and meeting deadlines are critical.  



REQUIRED SKILLS:  

- Excellent video editing skills (Premiere, Capcut) is REQUIRED  

- Excellent design skills (Photoshop/Illustrator/Canva or similar) is REQUIRED  

- Excellent understanding of social media creatives is REQUIRED  

- Excellent attention to detail is REQUIRED  

- Understanding brand design and US market fit is STRONG ADVANTAGE 



PREFERRED SKILLS (but not required):  

- Experience working with Amazon Seller Central is a PLUS  

- Experience with Microsoft Teams is a PLUS  

- Interest in culinary arts, cooking, kitchen industry is a PLUS  

- Interest in music recording, sound recording is a PLUS  

- Interest in American pop-culture is a PLUS 



PERKS:  

- Flexible hours with clear deadlines and deliverables 

- Paid time off with advance notice 

- Performance-based raises and bonuses tied to clear goals and metrics 

- Long-term growth opportunity within the company

- Philippine regular and special non-working holidays observed  



ABOUT THE COMPANY & ME:  



Since 2017, we have operated multiple e-commerce brands, selling across Amazon, Shopify, Etsy, and eBay in North America. This role will focus primarily on our core brand, with room to expand into additional brands over time. 



We operate with a performance mindset. We move quickly, test consistently, and evaluate creative work based on measurable results. 



Our team is small and focused. We prioritize accountability and long-term collaboration. We are seeking the RIGHT FIT - someone who is proactive, accountable, and motivated to grow with the company over the long term.





TO APPLY FOR THE JOB / APPLICATION PROCESS:  

1) Change the subject line to “Amazon Creative Lead - [Your Name]”  



2) Write 2-3 few sentences on why you would like this position, and why you are a good fit.  



3) Under that, put the following to make it easy for me to read.  

   1. Link to your portfolio/website/resume  

   2. Any links to current websites, social pages, ads you've designed for 



4) We will review your application. If accepted, we will respond with a simple test task that should take 1-2 hours to complete.  



5) Once the test task is submitted and reviewed, an interview will be scheduled. 



**NOTE: We have a rolling application for this position. There is no "due date" for the task but most applicants finish the task within 48 hours.

title: Technical Account Manager (TAM)
description:
Location: Irvine, CA (Hybrid)

Company: Atomic Technology Solutions

Reports To: Service & Operations Leadership



Position Overview

Atomic Technology Solutions is seeking a highly skilled Technical Account Manager (TAM) to serve as the strategic and technical owner of assigned client accounts.



This individual will:

Oversee client infrastructure health

Recommend technology improvements and upgrades

Conduct monthly license audits

Ensure accurate billing alignment

Lead Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)

Advocate for client needs internally

Maintain executive-level relationships

Ensure long-term client satisfaction and retention

This is a client-facing leadership role requiring fluent, professional English communication and the ability to translate complex technical topics into business value.



Core Responsibilities

1?? Infrastructure Health & Strategic Oversight

Perform regular reviews of client environments including:

Microsoft 365

Servers & virtualization

Networking

Security stack

Backup & disaster recovery

Identify aging infrastructure and lifecycle risks

Recommend hardware refreshes and modernization

Proactively identify security gaps and compliance risks

Develop and maintain a documented technology roadmap for each client

Ensure environments follow best practices and security standards

This role must think proactively, not reactively.



2?? Monthly License & User Audit (Critical Responsibility)

Conduct monthly Microsoft 365 and software license reviews

Validate:

Active employee counts

Terminated employee deactivations

Unused licenses

Over-licensed or under-licensed accounts

Coordinate with client HR or management to reconcile user changes

Ensure:

Client is not overpaying

Company billing aligns with actual usage

Identify upsell opportunities when growth occurs

Document all licensing changes in PSA

This protects both client trust and company revenue integrity.



3?? Client Advocacy & Satisfaction Ownership

Act as the voice of the client internally

Escalate recurring issues affecting client satisfaction

Identify operational pain points

Ensure service quality meets expectations

Maintain regular communication cadence

Build strong executive relationships

The TAM “owns the client experience.”



4?? Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)

Prepare structured QBR presentations including:

SLA performance metrics

Ticket trends

Security posture review

Infrastructure health

Licensing overview

Roadmap recommendations

Present findings in business language

Propose improvements and budget planning

Track follow-up action items

QBRs must be strategic, not just reporting sessions.



5?? Project Oversight & Coordination

Define project scope based on roadmap

Coordinate with engineering teams

Ensure timelines and client expectations are managed

Communicate project status clearly

Conduct post-project review and documentation



6?? Relationship Management

Maintain ongoing communication with assigned accounts

Build trust with decision-makers

Anticipate future needs

Increase client retention and long-term contracts

Support contract renewals and expansion opportunities

Required Qualifications

5+ years MSP or IT services experience

Strong Microsoft 365 expertise (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, Entra ID)

Infrastructure & networking fundamentals

Security best practices understanding

Experience leading executive-level client meetings

Excellent project coordination ability

Fluent, professional-level English (written and spoken)

Strong presentation skills

High attention to detail

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Client retention rate

License audit accuracy rate

Infrastructure health improvements

QBR completion & effectiveness

Client satisfaction score (CSAT)

Reduction of client escalations

Revenue growth from proactive recommendations



Personality & Soft Skills Required:

Highly organized

Strategic thinker

Detail-oriented

Confident communicator

Proactive mindset

Business-focused, not just technical

Strong ownership mentality

title: Remote Accountant for New Zealand Business
description:
Avant People is a dynamic, client-focused organization that delivers high-quality results to our clients and contractors. Our team of professionals brings a wealth of experience and a deep understanding of industry trends to ensure that we match the right people with the right opportunities.



Job Description: As a Remote Accountant, you will be responsible for managing a variety of accounting tasks, ensuring compliance with New Zealand accounting standards, and providing insightful financial analysis. You will work closely with our client's finance team to support their accounting needs and contribute to their business success. The role is full time and you must be available between 6 am and 4 pm Manila time to work seamlessly with the New Zealand client.



Key Responsibilities:



Accounting & Compliance: Manage and oversee client financial records, ensuring adherence to New Zealand accounting standards and regulatory requirements.

Financial Reporting: Prepare and review financial statements, reports, and budgets for accuracy and completeness.

Tax Preparation: Prepare and file tax returns, manage tax compliance, and provide guidance on tax-related matters in accordance with New Zealand tax laws.

Client Interaction: Act as the primary point of contact for clients, addressing their accounting inquiries, providing financial advice, and maintaining strong client relationships.

Process Improvement: Identify and implement improvements in accounting processes and systems to enhance efficiency and accuracy.

Financial Analysis: Conduct financial analysis and provide insights to support strategic decision-making for clients and the company.



Qualifications:



Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA certification is required.

Experience: Minimum of 5 years of professional accounting experience, with a focus on New Zealand accounting practices.

Technical Skills: Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Xero, MYOB) and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook). Experience with remote work tools is a plus.

Knowledge: In-depth understanding of New Zealand accounting standards, tax laws, and regulatory requirements.

Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to explain complex financial concepts in a clear and concise manner.

Attention to Detail: Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.

Self-motivated: Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines in a remote work environment.

Benefits:



Competitive salary

Flexible working hours

Remote work with the option to work from anywhere

Supportive team environment



Next steps:

1. Send the updated resume to 

2. Subject: NZ Accountant applicant - {Name}

3. Please include in your
:

4. Expected salary

5. Do you have Australia or New Zealand accounting experience?

title: Senior Backend Engineer  (Supabase / Postgres / AI) - Founding Team
description:
Hi there!

We’re building a new networking platform for startup founders, operators, and entrepreneurs.

We’re hiring a Senior Backend Engineer to design and own the core backend from the ground up — database architecture, AI matchmaking, security, and scalability.

This is a founding role with real owner ship and long-term architectural influence.



WHAT YOU'LL DO: 

- Design scalable relational database architecture (Postgres)

- Define clean, long-term data models and indexing strategies

- Build AI matchmaking using pgvector + embeddings

- Implement secure authentication & Row-Level Security (Supabase)

- Ensure performance, privacy, and system integrity from day one

- Help define backend standards as we scale



We are building carefully, not recklessly. Long-term architecture matters here.



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:

- Strong real-world SQL & Postgres experience

- Experience architecting production backend systems

- Deep understanding of relational data modelling

- Security-conscious, systems-oriented mindset

- Comfortable designing systems independently

- Must have a stable internet connection

- Preferably based in Manila

This role is best suited for engineers who enjoy building core systems — not just implementing tickets.



WORKING HOURS

- Filipino daylight hours (approx. 8am–5pm PH time)

- Some flexibility required to overlap with early UK time

- Full-time role

- Growth Path: Founding-level ownership, direct collaboration with the CTO, and long-term career growth



HOW TO APPLY

Send:

- Your resume

- A short message explaining a backend system you designed and why you’re proud of it

- A brief answer to:

 “What would you prioritize when designing a scalable backend from zero?”

: [your
 here]

Subject: "Senior Backend Engineer – [Your Name]"



If you want ownership, architectural influence, and to build something meaningful from day one — we’d love to hear from you.

title: Virtual Assistant Lead – Guest Relations & Operations (High EQ Communicator)
description:
We’re seeking a Virtual Assistant Lead with outstanding communication skills and emotional intelligence to oversee guest interactions and virtual operations for our expanding short?term rental business. This role is perfect for someone who takes pride in delivering white?glove hospitality, thrives under pressure, and can confidently step in to resolve issues in real time.



You’ll be the first point of contact for guests—handling inquiries, coordinating with internal teams, and ensuring every stay feels effortless. You’ll also lead and mentor a small team of virtual assistants while continuously optimizing systems and workflows as we scale.



Key Responsibilities:

- Manage the complete guest journey from inquiry to checkout, ensuring seamless communication and follow?up.

- Respond immediately to guest questions or issues through calls and messaging, maintaining professionalism and warmth at every touchpoint.

- Proactively de?escalate conflicts and address concerns with empathy, confidence, and creative problem?solving to ensure guest satisfaction.

- Coordinate closely with property management and cleaning teams, confirming turnovers, maintenance requests, and guest readiness.

- Call guests directly when needed to quickly clarify misunderstandings, resolve issues, and deliver personalized support.

- Turn negative experiences into positive reviews through sincere communication and thoughtful recovery actions.

- Lead, train, and oversee other virtual assistants to maintain consistency and accountability across guest communication and daily operations.

- Document and refine SOPs for communication, issue resolution, and operational flow to improve speed and accuracy.

- Identify operational bottlenecks and recommend improvements for pricing, scheduling, and workflow management.

- Provide exceptional customer service across all interactions—courteous, dependable, and solution?focused.

- Support light social media management and general administrative tasks as needed.



Requirements:

- Experience in short?term rental management (Airbnb, VRBO, 
, or similar).

- High emotional intelligence with a genuine passion for customer care and hospitality.

- EXCELLENT English communication skills, both written and verbal; neutral accent required

- Confident on the phone—comfortable calling guests and handling delicate or time?sensitive situations calmly and professionally.

- Proven ability to resolve guest issues quickly and empathetically, ensuring their experience ends positively.

- Leadership experience in managing a small virtual team and maintaining accountability.

- Highly organized, proactive, and detail?oriented, with strong problem?solving abilities.

- Tech?savvy across platforms used in hospitality (messaging tools, property management systems, and calendars).

- Reliable home workstation setup: computer, stable internet, monitor, and noise?canceling headset.

- Positive attitude, flexibility, and strong work ethic with a focus on service excellence.



Growth Opportunity:

This is a long?term position with room to grow into Operations or Regional roles as we expand. The right candidate will play a key part in shaping our guest operations standards and internal systems.



To apply, please submit: (applications will not be considered if both are not sent)

1. Your resume or CV

2. A short English voice sample (1–2 minutes introducing yourself and describing why you’re ideal for this role)

title: Customer Service & Appointment Coordinator- Remote
description:
Customer Service & Appointment Coordinator– Remote



Pay: $3–$7 per hour

Full-time | Long-term

US hours (Mountain standard Time)



Customer Service & Appointment Coordinator

Inbound Calls | Lead Qualification | Appointment Booking

We are hiring a confident, professional English-speaking Customer Service Representative to manage inbound calls, respond to follow-up inquiries, and book qualified appointments for our sales team.

This is a front-line role. You will represent our company on every call.

Strong, natural English communication is not optional. You must be able to speak clearly, understand nuance, and communicate with confidence and professionalism.



Key Responsibilities

* Answer inbound customer calls promptly and professionally

* Respond to follow-up questions via phone and text

* Call and text inbound leads to confirm interest and schedule appointments

* Follow qualification scripts accurately

* Book appointments directly into the calendar

* Handle common objections calmly and confidently

* Update detailed notes in our CRM

* Meet daily call volume and booking targets



Requirements (Please Read Carefully)

* C2-level or near-native English fluency (required)

* Clear, professional speaking voice

* Strong listening skills and conversational awareness

* Prior customer service, appointment setting, or call center experience

* Comfortable speaking with homeowners and business owners

title: Virtual assistant
description:
???? Part-Time Business Assistant (QuickBooks-Focused | Long-Term)



Read Carefully Before Applying



This role requires precision, accountability, and consistency. If you rush through tasks, dislike structure, or need constant supervision, this will not be a good fit.



If you love clean books, clear systems, and getting things right the first time — keep reading.



?



Role Overview



I am hiring a Virtual Business Assistant to support QuickBooks Online bookkeeping and administrative organization.

This role starts part-time (10–20 hours/week) and can grow in hours and responsibility once accuracy and reliability are proven.



This is a long-term position.



?



Hours & Compensation

 • Hours: 10–20 hours/week to start

 • Pay: Based on experience and demonstrated accuracy

 • Growth: Increased hours and responsibility after a successful first 30–60 days



?



Core Responsibilities



QuickBooks Online

 • Categorize transactions accurately and consistently

 • Reconcile bank and credit card accounts

 • Maintain clean, organized, audit-ready books

 • Flag unclear, missing, or questionable transactions before proceeding



Administrative Support

 • Maintain trackers and logs in Google Sheets

 • Organize documents clearly in Google Drive

 • Assist with invoices, statements, and financial records

 • Follow written SOPs and checklists exactly



?



Required Qualifications (Non-Negotiable)

 • Hands-on experience with QuickBooks Online

 • Strong attention to detail (errors will not be tolerated)

 • Comfortable working independently

 • Clear written English

 • Willingness to ask questions instead of guessing

 • Reliable internet and consistent availability



?



This Role Is NOT For You If:

 • You guess instead of asking

 • You rush to finish instead of finishing correctly

 • You dislike repetitive or detail-heavy work

 • You require daily reminders to complete tasks



?



Screening Process (Mandatory)



Only applicants who follow instructions exactly will be considered.



Your application must include:

 1. A brief introduction (2–3 sentences)

 2. Your QuickBooks Online experience (specific tasks + years)

 3. Your weekly availability

 4. Your expected hourly rate

 5. A short answer (3–5 sentences):

“How do you handle a transaction you are unsure how to categorize?”

 6. The word ACCURACY included somewhere in your response



Applicants who pass this step will complete a paid test task before final selection.



?



Final Note



This role is designed to reduce mental load, not create more work.

Accuracy, communication, and follow-thru is more important than speed

You will be the voice of this brand to customers every single day. You will manage customer
s and SMS, run social media communities across all brand channels, and support the CMO on marketing projects. On Saturdays and Sundays, you are the social media lead — trusted to represent the brand independently without supervision.

 management for the CMO

4 to 8 years of experience in marketing, social media, customer service, or a closely related field

Exceptional English communication skills, both written and verbal — you will be writing on behalf of a US brand every day

Proven experience managing social media accounts and engaging with online communities

Strong attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines independently

Must be based in major Philippine metropolitan area with fast, reliable internet connectivity — this role requires stable internet with no disruptions during work hours

Available to work Wednesday through Sunday OR Thursday through Monday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM PST (11:00 PM to 7:30 AM Philippine time, including weekends)

title: AI Music Producer
description:
Job Posting: AI Audio Producer & VA (Suno Specialist)

Role Overview

We are looking for a fast-paced, detail-oriented AI Audio Producer to create custom "Walk-Up Songs" for our brand and clients. You aren't just hitting "Generate"; you are an architect of sound who can take a reference track and replicate its energy, tempo, and vibe using Suno AI while customizing lyrics for a professional, high-end output.



Key Responsibilities

Reference Matching: Analyze a reference song’s "DNA" (BPM, genre, instrumentation, mood) and replicate that sound as closely as possible using advanced Suno prompting.



Lyric Architecture: Structure custom lyrics specifically for Suno’s engine. You must know how to use Metatags ([Drop], [Heavy Bass], [Staccato]) to ensure the brand name or hook hits with maximum impact.



Phonetic Tuning: Edit and "cheat" lyrics (using phonetic spelling) to ensure the AI pronounces brand names and client names perfectly every time.



Rapid Delivery: Turn around 2–3 high-quality variations based on a client brief within a short window.



Post-Production Polish: Basic mastering of the Suno output (EQ, leveling, and trimming) to ensure the song sounds professional over speakers or in social media content.



Technical Requirements

Mastery of Suno AI: Deep knowledge of V3.5/V4, including the "Upload Audio" reference feature and style-prompting.



Lyric Flow Knowledge: Ability to count syllables and write lyrics that fit a specific rhythm—avoiding "clunky" or "crowded" AI vocals.



DAW Proficiency: Experience with Audacity, FL Studio, Logic, or similar to trim the "Gold 30 Seconds" and normalize audio levels.



Quality Control: An ear for "AI hallucinations" (static, slurred words, or off-beat rhythms) and the discipline to discard subpar generations.



Preferred Qualifications

Experience in Sports Production or Event DJing.



Ability to isolate stems (vocals/instrumentals) for cleaner mixing.

title: SEO & GEO Execution Specialist

5. Authority & Off-Page SEO

-- Backlink prospecting

-- Anchor text strategy

-- Citation building

-- Local SEO optimization

-- Google Business Profile optimization

-- Conversion tracking setup

-- Cannibalization detection reports

-- Performance improvement recommendations



Required Skills & Qualifications

-- Strong understanding of technical SEO

-- Experience with schema markup

-- Excellent written English



Volume Expectations

title: CFO Support Accountant (Accrual-Focused)
description:
Read Carefully Before Applying



Working hours are non-negotiable.



You must be available Monday–Friday through 2:00 PM Pacific / 5:00 PM Eastern.



Applications without a resume link will not be reviewed.



This role requires real accrual-based accounting experience.



If your background is primarily cash-basis bookkeeping or transaction categorization without understanding balance sheet flow, this role is not a fit.



Non-Negotiable Requirements



You must already have hands-on experience with:



QuickBooks Online (daily use)

Accrual-based accounting, applied not theoretical

Maintaining and explaining a clean balance sheet

Payroll journal entries including wages, taxes, and accruals

Monthly bank and credit card reconciliations

Clear understanding of COGS vs operating expenses

Supporting multiple clients in a bookkeeping firm, CPA firm, or similar

At least 5 years of accounting or bookkeeping experience

Excellent, stable internet connection



If any of the above are missing, please do not apply.



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based fractional CFO firm supporting service-based businesses.



This is a tactical, detail-focused accounting role that supports CFO review and decision-making. Accuracy matters more than speed. This is not a training position.



This is a full-time, long-term role.



Core Responsibilities:

Maintain clean, accrual-based books in QuickBooks Online

Perform monthly bank and credit card reconciliations

Record and review payroll journal entries

Ensure proper classification between COGS and operating expenses

Maintain a clean and consistent chart of accounts

Proactively flag anomalies or unclear transactions

Prepare reliable financials for CFO review

Support month-end close and assigned client deadlines

Maintain client SOPs 



Required Skills:



Strong QuickBooks Online experience

Deep understanding of accrual accounting and balance sheet flow

Able to explain how and why transactions are recorded

High attention to detail and follow-through

Clear written and verbal English communication

Comfortable following structure while thinking independently



Work Schedule and Requirements



Full-time, Monday–Friday

Must be available through 2:00 PM PT / 5:00 PM ET

Reliable high-speed internet, verified during onboarding

Quiet, professional home office

Strong responsiveness during working hours



How to Apply



To be considered, submit:



A resume link using Google Drive or Dropbox

Written confirmation that you can consistently work through 2:00 PM PT / 5:00 PM ET



Applications missing either item will not be reviewed.

title: Implementation Coordinator
description:
Company: Conserva

Location: Remote (Must work according to Eastern Standard Time)

Schedule: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 11AM–8PM Eastern Time



About Conserva

Conserva is a forward-thinking company dedicated to delivering solar maintenance services and exceptional

support to our clients. We pride ourselves on high-quality service and fostering an inclusive, remote-first

work culture. We are excited to welcome talented professionals to join our dynamic team.



Position: Implementation Coordinator



What You'll Do:

• Schedule and Manage Service Visits: Coordinate and schedule inspection, cleaning, and upsell

service visits across our customer base. Proactively manage the calendar to ensure timely coverage

and full preparation before each job.

• Organize and Maintain Tasks in ClickUp: Build, update, and manage tasks within ClickUp to track

job statuses, service agreements, audits, and follow-ups. Ensure every task contains complete and

accurate information prior to dispatch.

• Coordinate with Service Providers: Serve as the primary point of contact for field service providers.

Communicate job details clearly, answer questions, and ensure service providers have everything they

need to complete visits successfully.

• Routing and Map-Based Scheduling: Review geographic service areas and use mapping tools to

build efficient daily routing for service visits, minimizing drive time while maximizing field capacity.

• Conduct Audits and Quality Checks: Perform regular audits of task lists, service agreements,

unpaid accounts, and customer statuses to maintain data integrity and ensure timely follow-up across

all open items.

• Manage Customer and Internal Communications: Respond to service team inquiries, send 24-hour

appointment reminders, follow up on unpaid balances, and escalate issues as needed to keep

operations running smoothly.

• Monitor Dashboards and Analytics: Review ClickUp dashboards and performance data daily to

identify incomplete tasks, bottlenecks, or missing information. Resolve or escalate issues promptly.

• Support SP Onboarding: Assist in onboarding new service providers, ensuring they understand

workflows and have access to the tools and information required for their roles.



What We're Looking For:

• Strong Communication Skills: Clear written and verbal communication is essential for coordinating

across internal teams and external service providers.

• Organizational Excellence: Ability to manage multiple moving parts simultaneously, prioritize

effectively, and maintain meticulous attention to detail in a remote environment.

• Process-Oriented Mindset: Comfortable working within structured systems and SOPs; able to

identify gaps and take initiative to keep workflows on track.

• Tech-Savviness: Hands-on experience with ClickUp or similar project management tools; familiarity

with CRMs, mapping tools, and spreadsheets. Ability to adapt quickly to new software.

• Experience: Previous experience in scheduling, operations coordination, field service support, or a

similar administrative role is strongly preferred.

• Remote Readiness: A reliable internet connection, a quiet workspace, and the discipline and

self-motivation to work independently and meet daily expectations.



What We Offer:

• Competitive Compensation: $1,000 USD per month (with two paydays per month).

• Career Growth: Opportunities for professional advancement and development through ongoing

training and mentorship.

• Inclusive, Remote-First Environment: Join a diverse international team dedicated to supporting your

success no matter where you are located.

• Industry Impact: Be part of a company that is committed to renewable energy and sustainable

solutions.





Ready to Make a Difference?

As the first step of the process, please use 
 to create a free short video of yourself speaking

and include the link to this video in your application message.

title: Recruiting Expert
description:
Job Title: Recruiting Expert – Comfort Keepers

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Department: Talent Acquisition / Human Resources

About Comfort Keepers

Comfort Keepers is a nationally recognized leader in in home care, dedicated to helping seniors maintain independence, dignity, and quality of life. Our caregivers make a meaningful impact every day—and we’re committed to building teams who share our passion for compassionate, client centered care.

We are seeking an experienced and motivated  Recruiting Expert to help us attract exceptional caregivers, administrative staff, and leadership talent across multiple locations. If you thrive in a mission-driven environment and love connecting people with purposeful work, this is the role for you.

________________________________________

What You’ll Do

• Lead full cycle recruitment for caregiver and support roles across multiple Comfort Keepers territories.

• Partner with company management and  staff to define staffing needs and recruitment strategy.

• Source caregivers and other candidates using creative online strategies, job boards, social media, referral programs, and community networks.

• Conduct virtual interviews/screenings  and assess candidate qualities such as compassion, reliability, and alignment with the Comfort Keepers mission.

• Maintain strong talent pipelines to support ongoing and future staffing needs.

• Improve remote hiring processes, track KPIs, and provide regular reporting on recruitment activity.

• Ensure a warm, engaging, and mission aligned candidate experience from first contact to onboarding.

• Collaborate with management and operations teams on recruiting campaigns and initiatives.

________________________________________

What We’re Looking For

• Proven experience as a Recruiter or Talent Acquisition Specialist—healthcare or caregiving recruitment experience is a strong plus.

• Strong ability to identify, attract, and screen caregiving talent for in home care roles.

• Excellent communication skills and comfort interviewing/screening via phone and video.

• Ability to manage multiple high-volume requisitions while meeting deadlines.

• Experience working in a remote environment with strong organizational skills.

• Familiarity with ATS platforms and sourcing tools. 

• Passion for serving seniors and improving quality of life through compassionate care.

________________________________________

Nice-to-Have Skills

• Experience recruiting caregivers, CNAs, HHAs, or health services staff.

• Understanding of senior care, home care, or healthcare hiring compliance.

• Knowledge of local labor market trends and caregiver recruiting best practices.

________________________________________

Why You’ll Love Working With Comfort Keepers

• 100% remote work with flexibility 

• Excellent performance-based earnings with potential above and beyond salary

• The opportunity  and autonomy to make systems related changes as our business needs and hiring landscape change.

title: Healthcare Business Cold Caller
description:
We are seeking a confident and results-driven Cold Caller to support our healthcare brokerage team by generating new seller leads. In this role, you will conduct outbound calls to healthcare agency owners using publicly available directories such as the CDPH website. Your primary objective is to introduce our brokerage services, identify potential sellers, and qualify leads for our broker.



This position requires strong communication skills, persistence, and the ability to handle objections professionally. You will receive structured training, scripts, and ongoing support to ensure you understand our services, target market, and calling process.



This is an ideal opportunity for someone with B2B cold calling experience who wants to grow long-term in sales and lead generation within a specialized healthcare industry niche.



This role is focused on quality conversations and uncovering real opportunities, not just dialing numbers.

You will work closely with our team and receive structured training, scripts, and ongoing guidance to ensure you understand the market, messaging, and qualification process.



Key Responsibilities:

Use the CDPH website and provided healthcare directories to identify qualified agency owners to contact

Conduct outbound cold calls to introduce our brokerage services clearly and professionally

Identify agency owners who may be considering selling now or in the near future

Thoroughly qualify potential sellers (license status, revenue size, payer mix, timeline, motivation, expectations)

Ask strategic questions to uncover real selling intent, not just curiosity

Confidently handle basic objections and redirect conversations toward value

Set well-qualified follow-up calls or appointments for our broker

Enter detailed, accurate notes into the CRM immediately after each call

Keep the CRM organized and updated with clear lead status and next steps

Provide consistent daily activity and performance updates



Qualifications:

Proven experience in cold calling, telemarketing, or B2B outbound sales

Strong English communication skills with a clear and confident speaking voice

Ability to build quick rapport and ask strategic qualifying questions

Comfortable handling objections and navigating rejection professionally

Detail-oriented and disciplined with accurate note-taking

Experience using CRM systems and maintaining organized lead records

Self-motivated and results-driven, not just activity-driven

Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

Available to work during U.S. business hours 

Experience in business brokerage, real estate, or healthcare is a strong plus

To make sure you’ve read this entire job post carefully, please use this exact subject line when applying:

“Your Name – HBB Cold Call” Ex. “Ralph - HBB Cold Call”



How to Apply

To apply, please send the following:

A 2–3 minute Loom video introducing yourself and answering:

 • Your experience with cold calling or B2B outreach

 • How you handle rejection

 • Your biggest cold calling achievement

Your updated resume

title: Estimator – Modular Homes
description:
We’re looking for an Estimator to support our growing modular homes business. This role suits someone who is comfortable working independently, using drawings and best-practice construction knowledge to build accurate cost estimates for modular homes, worker accommodation and custom designs.

You’ll work closely with our designer and operations team, using drawings, previous projects and supplier price lists to determine true build cost — including clear separation of labour and materials. While we’ll provide support, systems and pricing references (including supplier lists and historic plans), you’ll be expected to take ownership of your estimates and apply sound judgement.

Australian construction experience is preferred, along with the confidence to price both standard designs and special requests.



Key Responsibilities

Prepare accurate cost estimates for modular homes, worker accommodation and custom builds

Independently estimate from drawings, specifications and design information

Break down costs clearly into labour vs materials

Use supplier pricing (e.g. Bunnings product lists, trade suppliers) and internal rate schedules to determine build cost

Review and use historic plans and previous projects as estimating references

Work closely with the designer to ensure estimates align with design intent, constructability and efficiency

Price variations, revisions and client-specific design changes

Identify opportunities to improve productivity or reduce costs through design or construction methods, and confidently raise these with the team

Assist with pricing of non-standard requests (initially focusing on basic inclusions such as bathrooms, kitchens and fixtures)



About You

Experience or strong exposure to Australian construction methods, materials and pricing

Confident reading and interpreting drawings to produce estimates independently

Comfortable making judgement calls using best knowledge, not just fixed templates

Strong attention to detail and ability to structure clear cost breakdowns

Confident with numbers and spreadsheets

Good communicator — able to collaborate closely with designers, suppliers and operations

Very strong attention to detail



Strong Bonus

Modular / prefab experience

Rural / worker accommodation / mining camps

Previous work with Australian engineers

Understanding of BAL, wind regions, and regional construction

title: Case Manager
description:

title: Automation Engineer VA (n8n + Web Scraping + Podio Integration)
description:
We are a U.S.-based real estate acquisitions company automating our lead intake process.



We need a highly technical Automation Engineer to build and maintain an automated system that:



• Reads daily foreclosure lead
s

• Logs into a gated website

• Scrapes property detail pages after login

• Extracts structured data (Case Number, Balance Due, etc.)

• Pulls a property value estimate (Redfin/Realtor/County Websites)

• Applies custom financial logic (spread calculation)

• Dedupes against Podio

• Automatically creates Podio items if criteria are met

• Skips leads that do not meet our spread rule



This role is NOT basic admin work. This is technical systems building. You must be comfortable working with browser automation, HTML parsing, APIs, and workflow automation tools.



Core Responsibilities



• Build automation workflows in n8n (preferred) or Make

• Use Playwright or Puppeteer to automate login-based scraping

• Extract structured data from HTML using selectors/XPath

• Handle session persistence, cookies, throttling, and retry logic

• Integrate with Podio API for search + create item

• Implement business logic for valuation rules and spread calculation

• Create fallback logic for missing data

• Build logging and error handling

• Maintain and improve automation reliability



Required Technical Experience



You MUST have experience with:



• n8n (required)

• Playwright or Puppeteer (browser automation)

• Web scraping of login-protected websites

• HTML / DOM / CSS selectors / XPath

• REST APIs

• JavaScript (strong)

• Node.js

• Handling cookies, sessions, and authentication

• Debugging network requests in DevTools

• Basic financial/math logic implementation



Strongly Preferred Experience



• Podio API experience

• Real estate data experience

• Redfin/Realtor scraping experience

• Automation error handling + retry systems

• Building persistent browser sessions

• Working with Gmail API

• Data deduplication logic

• Rate limiting / anti-bot awareness



Important! This role requires problem-solving. Websites change. Selectors break. Sessions expire.



You must be able to:

• Debug broken scrapers

• Adjust selectors

• Inspect network calls

• Implement workarounds

• Build resilient systems



To Apply Please Include:



• Links to automation projects you’ve built or GitHub (if available)

• Experience scraping login-protected websites

• Tools you’ve used (Playwright, Puppeteer, etc.)

• Internet Speed Test



We look forward to working with you!

title: Google Ads & SEO Specialist
description:
About the Role

We’re looking for a genuinely experienced Google Ads & SEO Specialist to take ownership of search performance across a portfolio of client accounts.



This role sits at the intersection of paid and organic search. You’ll lead Google Ads strategy and optimisation while also guiding SEO direction — identifying opportunities, prioritising work, and ensuring search visibility and lead generation improve over time.



You won’t be micromanaged, and you won’t be handed step-by-step instructions. We’re looking for someone senior enough to assess, decide, and act — someone who understands why performance changes and knows how to respond quickly and logically.



This is a part-time contractor role suited to a specialist who prefers focused, meaningful work over high-volume task execution.



What You’ll Do



Google Ads 

- Manage and optimise Search, Performance Max, and remarketing campaigns

- Improve lead quality, conversion rates, and cost efficiency

- Review keyword targeting, match types, negatives, and bidding strategies

- Identify wasted spend and scaling opportunities

- Develop and run structured testing plans

- Ensure conversion tracking and attribution are reliable



SEO (Strategic & Hands-On)

- Conduct technical and on-page SEO audits

- Identify ranking opportunities and prioritise actions

- Create SEO roadmaps and implementation plans

- Review site structure, internal linking, and metadata

- Collaborate with developers and content teams where required

- Reporting & Communication

- Provide clear monthly performance reporting with insights and next steps

- Share concise updates on progress, risks, and opportunities

- Translate performance data into plain-English business impact

- Offer proactive recommendations rather than reactive reporting



What You’ll Bring

- 6+ years’ experience managing Google Ads and SEO end-to-end

- Deep understanding of search intent, keyword strategy, and conversion optimisation

- Proven ability to improve lead generation or revenue outcomes

- Strong analytical skills and confident decision-making

- Experience working independently and managing priorities

- Excellent written communication and structured reporting

- Ability to collaborate with developers, marketers, and stakeholders



Nice to Have

- Experience with B2B lead generation or service-based businesses

- Familiarity with GA4, GTM, and Looker Studio reporting

- Experience reviewing landing pages and conversion pathways

- Understanding of technical SEO and site performance factors



What Success Looks Like

- Improved lead quality and cost efficiency in Google Ads

- Measurable gains in organic visibility and search performance

- Clear, reliable reporting and communication

- Proactive identification of issues and opportunities

- Well-structured, well-maintained accounts and search strategies



Why This Role Appeals

- Flexible part-time hours

- Remote work 

- High trust and autonomy

- Opportunity to make meaningful impact across multiple accounts

- Long-term potential for the right specialist



If you’re a senior search specialist who enjoys analysing performance, improving outcomes, and owning results, we’d love to hear from you.

?

?

?

title: Real Estate Office Administrator

We’re looking for a highly organised and detail-oriented Real Estate Office Administrator to support the day-to-day operations of a busy real estate office in New Zealand.

This is a process-driven role focused on keeping listings, compliance, documentation, and databases running smoothly behind the scenes. You will play a key role in ensuring agents can focus on clients and sales while you manage the operational workflow.

The work is structured and repeatable, ideal for someone who enjoys checklists, systems, and completing tasks accurately and efficiently. You’ll be handling documents, tracking deadlines, updating records, and making sure nothing slips through the cracks.

This role begins at approximately 20 hours per week, with the opportunity to scale to full-time hours during peak periods.



What You’ll Do

- Upload and download documents and PDFs

- Maintain listing records and ensure required information is complete

- Assemble and organise real estate documentation packs

- Update compliance systems and follow up where required

- Support AML documentation tracking and file completion

- Enter and maintain records in the CRM system

- Set up listing files and organise client documentation

- Keep database records tidy and up to date

- Monitor and manage pipeline progress

- Marketing & Coordination

- Assist with marketing administration and listing assets

- Prepare property information packs and upload materials

- Coordinate document preparation for campaigns

- Ensure marketing and listing information is accurate

- General Administrative Support

- Follow structured workflows and checklists

- Track progress across multiple listings simultaneously

- Communicate updates clearly with the office team

- Help keep operations organised and moving



What You’ll Bring

- 4+ years of previous experience as a Virtual Assistant or Administrator (real estate experience highly regarded)

- Strong attention to detail and accuracy

- Comfort handling large volumes of documentation

- Excellent organisation and time management

- Confidence following processes and checklists

- Clear written communication

- Reliable and consistent work habits

- Ability to work independently without supervision

- Fluent and Professional English



Technical Requirements

- Comfortable working with CRMs and online platforms

Ideal Traits

- Methodical and structured

- Process-oriented

- Calm under deadlines

- Enjoys administrative work and organisation



Why This Role Is a Good Fit

- Structured, repeatable tasks with clear workflows

- Long-term role with consistent hours

- Opportunity to grow to full-time during busy periods

- Supportive, professional team environment

- Stable and ongoing workload



If you enjoy organisation, accuracy, and helping a busy team run smoothly behind the scenes, we’d love to hear from you.

description:

This is a hands-on optimisation role suited to someone who genuinely enjoys working inside Google Ads — analysing data, testing ideas, and improving results week over week.



You’ll be responsible for improving lead quality, reducing wasted spend, and identifying scalable growth opportunities. We’re not looking for someone to “set and forget” campaigns — we want a performance marketer who actively manages accounts and understands the commercial impact of their decisions.



This is a part-time contractor position with flexibility and autonomy. You’ll be trusted to manage your workload and communicate clearly, without micromanagement.



What You’ll Do

- Review account structure, match types, negatives, and bidding strategies

- Identify and reduce wasted spend while improving lead quality

- Conduct keyword research and intent mapping

- Run structured testing (ad copy, extensions, targeting, landing page alignment)

- Monitor and improve CPA, conversion rates, and overall efficiency

- Ensure tracking accuracy (conversion actions, UTMs, GA4 basics)

- Provide clear monthly performance reports and short weekly updates

- Collaborate with designers, developers, or marketers where needed



What You’ll Bring

- Strong understanding of search intent, bidding strategies, and optimisation

- Confidence working across multiple accounts simultaneously

- Analytical mindset — comfortable interpreting data and making decisions

- Excellent written communication and structured reporting

Nice to Have

- Experience with B2B or service-based lead generation

- Familiarity with landing page optimisation or CRO principles

- Experience with GA4, GTM, or Looker Studio

- Exposure to Performance Max in lead-gen environments



What Success Looks Like

- Consistent optimisation and active account management

- Improved conversion efficiency and lead quality

- Clean account structure and thoughtful testing

- Clear communication and reliable reporting

- Proactive recommendations, not just maintenance



Why This Role Appeals

?

title: Graphic Website Designers: $6 to $8 per hour
description:
Senior Graphic Designer: Custom Website Design & AI-Enhanced Creative (Remote / Freelance ? Fulltime Potential)



We’re a growing US-based web design and digital marketing agency looking for experienced senior-level graphic designers who specialize in custom website design and modern digital branding.



This role is for designers who combine high-level creative thinking, strong execution skills, and professional reliability, and who are excited to leverage AI-assisted design tools thoughtfully (not as shortcuts).



If you take pride in polished, strategic design work and thrive in a professional, fast-moving creative environment, we’d love to connect.



???? What You’ll Be Responsible For: 



+ Custom Website Design (Primary Focus)



+ Designing high-end, custom website UI concepts (not template-heavy work)



+ Translating brand strategy into clean, conversion-focused visuals

+ AI-Enhanced Creative Workflow

+ Maintaining originality, consistency, and brand integrity



+ Marketing & Brand Graphics



+ Creating A+ content, landing page visuals, digital marketing assets, and brand materials



+ Working across web, social, and occasional print production needs



+ Professional Delivery & Collaboration



+ Managing deadlines independently



+ Communicating clearly with design, marketing, and development teams



+ Maintaining consistent design quality across projects



? What We’re Specifically Looking For (Senior-Level Traits)



+ Strategic Design Thinking: You don’t just make things look good; you solve business and UX problems visually.



+ Attention to Detail: Pixel precision, typography mastery, spacing discipline, and consistent design systems.



+ Professional Reliability: Strong communication, deadline ownership, and proactive project management.



+ Creative Maturity: Ability to accept feedback, iterate quickly, and maintain quality under deadlines.



+ AI Design Judgment: Understanding when AI helps, and when true design expertise matters more.



???? Required Skills & Experience (Strict Criteria)



Please apply only if you meet most of these:



+ Proven experience designing custom websites (portfolio required)



+ Strong Figma workflow (components, auto-layout, design systems)



+ Adobe Creative Suite proficiency (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)



+ Strong typography, color theory, layout, and UX awareness



+ Experience designing for marketing conversion (landing pages, A+ content, etc.)



+ Familiarity with AI design tools and prompt workflows



+ Understanding of print production basics (CMYK, bleed, DPI, export prep)



Big Plus:



+ Experience working with web developers or design handoff processes



+ Branding and identity design experience



+ Motion/interactive design awareness



???? Application Requirements (Carefully Reviewed)



To be considered, please include these required materials:



+ Your resume or CV



+ Portfolio of graphic design work



+ At least 5 custom website designs you personally created



Short introduction covering:



+ Your experience level



+ Why you’re a strong fit for this role



+ Your primary design tools and workflow



Also Include:



+ Your availability (hours/week)



+ Your remote workspace setup



?? Applications without real website design samples will not be reviewed.

?? Template-only portfolios or heavily AI-generated work without refinement may be declined.



???? Who Typically Succeeds Here



Designers who:



+ Think like senior creatives, not production-only designers



+ Care deeply about design quality and craft



+ Communicate professionally and reliably



+ Want long-term collaboration rather than one-off gigs



+ Enjoy combining traditional design skill with modern AI tools



If you’re passionate about thoughtful design, continuous growth, and meaningful creative work, we’d love to see your portfolio.



Thank you,



Phong (Peter) Nguyen

title: Remote Financial Operations & KPI Manager
description:
Location: 100% Remote (US-Based Healthcare Company)

Shift: USA, Mountain time, to start however once trained can easily work days in the phillipines, but need at least 2hrs a day overlap to CEO Meeting Daily

Role Type: Full-Time / Long-Term



The Mission

We are a fast-growing, psychiatric healthcare group in the US. We are refocusing on Operational Excellence.



We don't need a theorist; we need a Financial Architect. This role replaces a departing CFO and focuses on the "engine room"—tracking numbers, managing payroll, paying bills, and building the dashboards that tell us exactly where the business stands every Monday morning. If you love building clarity from chaos and turning raw data into actionable insights, we want to talk to you.



???? Your Key Responsibilities

The Pulse (KPIs): Own the weekly KPI dashboard (Revenue, Payroll %, Provider Productivity, Collections, and AR).



The Books: Full-cycle QuickBooks Online management, including meticulous bank reconciliation and expense categorization.



The People: Audit payroll, analyze labor costs, and ensure "hours worked vs. revenue generated" stays in balance.



The Flow: Manage accounts payable (bills) and ensure financial data integrity across multiple clinic locations.



The Future: Assist the CEO and fractional CFO with budgeting and forecasting models.



The Standard: Help design and document Financial SOPs so our operations are scalable and "bulletproof."



???? Required Skills & Experience

US Healthcare Experience: You must understand US Medical Billing/RCM (the gap between "date of service" and "date of collection").



QuickBooks Pro: Advanced experience in QBO, specifically using Class Tracking for multi-location reporting.



Sheets/Excel Wizard: You should be comfortable with Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs/XLOOKUPs, and building clean, visual dashboards.



Detail Obsession: You find the $10 discrepancy that everyone else misses.



Communication: Fluent written and spoken English. You can explain why a number is down, not just that it is down.



Proactive Nature: You don't wait for the CEO to ask for a report; you have it ready before they think of it.



???? Ideal Candidate Profile

You are calm under pressure and comfortable with a fast-moving CEO.



You value discretion—handling sensitive psychiatric practice data and payroll requires a high level of integrity.



You prefer "building the system" over just "following a list."



???? How to Apply (Strict Requirements)

Failure to follow these steps will result in your application being ignored.



Resume: Updated PDF version.



Loom Video (2–3 mins): Briefly explain your experience managing US healthcare financials, your proficiency with QuickBooks, and one specific time you found a cost-saving or error that others missed.



The Proof: Provide a screenshot or link to a KPI Dashboard you have built (please redact/blur any sensitive previous client info).
