title: Virtual Assistant (SEO Agency) | $800/mo + | US Hours
description:
Virtual Assistant (SEO Agency) | $800 USD+/mo | US Hours



$800 USD/month | 13th Month Pay 



Remodel Titans is a US-based agency that helps kitchen and bathroom remodeling contractors dominate local search. We're niche-focused, systems-driven, and growing fast.



The Role

We're looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support our SEO team. No SEO experience required — we'll train you on everything. What we need is someone reliable, organized, and sharp enough to follow systems without letting things slip.

You'll be working inside our SOPs and ClickUp workflows, handling tasks that keep our client accounts running smoothly. You'll have a team around you, clear instructions for every process, and leadership that actually supports you.

This is a great fit if you're the kind of person who thrives with structure, takes pride in getting the small things right, and wants to build real skills in a growing industry.



What You'll Be Doing

- Following SOPs to complete SEO-related tasks across multiple client accounts

- Updating and managing tasks in ClickUp — keeping statuses, due dates, and details accurate

- Assisting with Google Business Profile updates, citation management, and basic on-page tasks

- QA checks on content, links, and deliverables before they go to clients

- Organizing files, tracking deadlines, and flagging anything that looks off

- Supporting the SEO team with research, data entry, and reporting tasks



What We're Looking For

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail — you don't miss things

- Experience working in ClickUp or similar project management tools

- Comfortable following SOPs and structured workflows

- Reliable and consistent — you show up, you follow through

- Strong written English

- Available to work US Eastern Standard Time hours

- Comfortable with time tracking

- No SEO experience needed — we provide full training



Bonus Points If You Have

- Any exposure to SEO, digital marketing, or agency work

- Experience as a VA supporting a team or managing tasks across multiple clients

- Familiarity with ClickUp and Google Workspace



What You'll Get

- $800 USD/month base salary

- 13th-month pay

- Full SOPs and training for every single process — no guesswork

- Supportive team that wants you to succeed

- Long-term stability with a growing agency

- Real opportunity to grow into an SEO specialist role as you learn



How to Apply

Apply with at least 10 apply points, answering the following questions — in this order. Please include the words "blue coconut" somewhere in your application.

1. What is the link to your CV (with necessary viewing permissions)?

2. Do you have experience using ClickUp or another project management tool? Briefly describe how you used it.

5. BONUS (optional): Record a loom video introducing yourself and show us how you stay organized.

title: Wholesale Product Research & Catalog Analysis VA (Amazon FBA)
description:
We are a U.S.-based wholesale distribution company focused on building long-term relationships with authorized suppliers and identifying profitable, low-risk products for Amazon FBA.



We are looking for a highly analytical Virtual Assistant with experience in wholesale product research (NOT online arbitrage).



Your primary responsibility will be to analyze large supplier catalogs (100–500+ SKUs at a time) and apply strict filtering rules to identify viable products.







Responsibilities



• Match supplier products to the correct Amazon ASIN

• Use Keepa to review price history, stability, and trends

• Identify Amazon Retail presence and Buy Box behavior

• Count FBA sellers and assess competition level

• Calculate ROI, net margin, and break-even cost

• Eliminate high-risk, unstable, or low-margin products

• Present a clean shortlist (5–15 strong SKUs per batch)

• Clearly explain why each product passes or fails



This role requires structured thinking, strong numerical skills, and attention to detail.





Filtering Standards (Must Follow)



A product should generally meet:



• Minimum 30% ROI (40%+ preferred)

• Minimum 30% net margin

• Stable or increasing price history

• 10 or fewer FBA sellers preferred

• Amazon Retail is not dominating the listing

• No major IP or brand restriction risks



If a product does not meet these standards, it must be eliminated.



Requirements



• Strong experience using Keepa (REQUIRED)

• Understanding of Amazon BSR and sales velocity

• Ability to calculate ROI and margins accurately

• Strong Google Sheets skills

• Stable internet connection

• Strong written English

• Ability to work independently and follow structured rules



?



Preferred (Not Required)



• Wholesale sourcing experience

• Experience cleaning large supplier catalogs

• Experience working with U.S.-based Amazon sellers







To Apply, Please Include:

	1.	Your experience analyzing wholesale supplier catalogs.

	2.	A screenshot of a Keepa chart you have analyzed.

	3.	A short Loom video (2–3 minutes) explaining how you determine if a product is profitable.

	4.	In the first line of your application, write: “Wholesale Filtering Specialist.”



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered.

s/messages for our review and sending when needed.



3. Family admin and support with our daughter



Draft responses to daycare/school admin requests.

Help coordinate activities outside school hours.

Research options for clothes/shoes as she grows.



4. Working with our au pair and nanny



Help us better utilise our au pair’s time by planning small organising projects.

Coordinate simple task lists for the au pair (e.g. sorting outgrown clothes, organising toy storage, preparing items for donation).

Gather input from the au pair and nanny for grocery lists and household supplies, and incorporate this into draft orders for our approval.



5. Shopping, services and life admin



Prepare suggested meal orders based on our preferences and calendar, ready for approval.

Prepare draft online grocery orders for our approval, including input from au pair and nanny.

Research and present options for personal purchases (clothes, kids’ items, household goods, services, gifts) with links and brief pros/cons.

Maintain a central “family ops” list of active tasks and priorities and send a concise weekly summary: what’s booked, what’s waiting on us, and what’s coming up next week.



Support for not?for?profit and work (secondary)

As capacity allows, you may also:



Not?for?profit (Andrew’s role as Chair):

Assist with diary management and scheduling board and committee meetings.

Coordinate calendars, send proposed times, and manage basic follow?up on RSVPs and rescheduling.



Light business and investment admin:

Help with simple research.

Assist with basic
 drafting, diary coordination and travel planning for meetings.



Hours and pay

Hours: Flexible, generally 5–10 hours per week, with some variation (occasionally more, occasionally less).



We are looking for someone open to a long?term, casual arrangement.



Rate: Starting at USD 6 per hour, with the possibility of increases over time based on performance and trust.



You will log your hours, and we will pay weekly or fortnightly via Wise.



There will be an initial paid probation period so we can both test that the fit, communication and quality of work are right.



Requirements

Strong written English and clear, friendly communication style.

Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow instructions.

Very organised, with experience using tools like Google Calendar, Outlook, Gmail and spreadsheets.

Comfortable researching online (using Australian sources), comparing options and presenting clear summaries.

Discreet and trustworthy with personal and financial information.

Able to work with some overlap in Australian time zone (Sydney) for check?ins.



How to apply

To help us manage applications, please answer these screening questions clearly in your application:



What days and times (Sydney time) are you usually available each week?



Are you happy with a casual, flexible role at USD 6 per hour for roughly 5–10 hours per week? Alternatively, please advise your hourly rate. 



Do you currently have other work or clients? If yes, briefly describe.



Give an example of where you have performed similar work. 



Please also include a link to your CV.

Applications without a video introduction will not be reviewed.

title: Replo Sales Page / Pre-Lander Builder (Shopify)
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Replo Sales Page & Pre-Lander Builder who can build, optimize, and continuously improve high-converting pre-landers and sales pages across Shopify (Replo) and multiple funnel-building platforms.



This role is only for someone with proven experience in high-performance funnels, strong attention to detail, a conversion-driven mindset, and the ability to ship fast, test fast, and iterate even faster.

To show you pay attention to detail, please start your application with the word “AI Part time”.



What You’ll Be Responsible For (Core Responsibilities):

As our Funnel Builder, you own everything related to funnel creation, optimization, and performance.



Pre-Landers & Sales Pages:

- Build high-converting pre-sell pages, advertorials & bridge pages

- Build long-form sales pages and product pages optimized for conversions

- Implement branding, UGC, social proof, and CRO principles in layouts

- Ensure fast loading speed, clean mobile responsiveness, and clear UX flow



A/B Testing & Optimization:

- Launch multiple variations for A/B testing (headlines, layouts, sections)

- Continuously analyze data and iterate based on performance

- Improve conversion rate, average order value (AOV), and time-on-page

- Identify friction points and implement CRO fixes proactively



Funnel Implementation:

- Work inside Shopify (Replo)

- Work with external funnel tools if needed (Funnelish, Shopify)

- Integrate tracking, pixels, UTM structures & analytics setups

- Troubleshoot and solve issues fast without needing follow-up guidance



Ownership & Speed:

- Work closely with the founders and creative team

- Understand our target audience deeply (mature women 45+)

- Build funnels fast enough for rapid scaling

- Stay ahead of problems and optimize before being asked



What We Are Looking For (Skills & Experience)



We need someone who is not a beginner — someone who knows how to build performance funnels in a D2C environment and understands the difference between “nice design” and conversion-driven design.



Requirements:

- 2–3+ years of experience building funnels for e-commerce or agencies

- Proven track record with pre-landers, advertorials, and sales pages

- Strong experience with Shopify landing page builders (preferably Replo) and other builders

- Experience with A/B testing tools, CRO frameworks, and data-driven optimization

- Understanding of D2C paid performance: Meta ads, UGC ads, landing-page psychology

- Fast execution, strong attention to detail, zero micromanagement needed

- Part time availability (20+ hours) with flexibility when testing is needed (optional- possibility of transitioning to Full-Time). 

- Based on experience, we may need to do a trial run for the first 2 weeks to see if you're a good fit on an hourly rate. 



What You Can Expect

- Competitive salary depending on experience

- A long-term role with a fast-growing D2C brand

- Performance-driven environment with high standards

- Weekly sprint calls & monthly KPI reviews

- Creative freedom for testing + clear guidance when needed

- Opportunity to directly influence conversion rate, AOV, and revenue

- Work closely with founders in a brand that’s scaling rapidly



Ready to Build Funnels That Scale?

Please send the following:

- Your CV

- Examples of funnels, pre-landers, and sales pages you’ve built (especially on Replo)

- Your background in e-commerce funnel building

title: Affiliate Marketing Manager
description:
About Us:

We are a dynamic lead generation company specializing in providing high-quality leads to businesses across various industries. We take pride in our innovative approach, cutting-edge technology, and commitment to delivering exceptional results for our clients. As we continue to expand our operations, we are seeking a talented and motivated individual to join our team as an Affiliate Marketing Manager.



Position Overview:

As an Affiliate Marketing Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving our affiliate marketing program to new heights. You will be responsible for developing and managing relationships with affiliates, optimizing performance, and implementing strategies to maximize lead generation. This is a unique opportunity for a results-driven individual to make a significant impact on our company's growth and success.



Responsibilities:



Develop and execute affiliate marketing strategies to drive lead generation and revenue growth.

Identify and recruit new affiliates to expand our partner network.

Nurture and maintain relationships with existing affiliates, ensuring their success and satisfaction.

Monitor and analyze affiliate performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing optimization strategies.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and product development, to ensure alignment and synergy in affiliate programs.

Stay abreast of industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging opportunities to stay ahead in the affiliate marketing landscape.

Track and report on key performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.



Qualifications:



Proven experience as an Affiliate Marketing Manager or similar role.

In-depth knowledge of affiliate marketing principles, strategies, and best practices.

Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to make informed decisions.

Excellent communication and relationship-building skills.

Self-motivated with a proactive and results-driven approach.

Familiarity with lead generation and digital marketing trends.



Requirements:



Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in affiliate marketing.

Conversational/fluent in English

Proficient in using affiliate marketing tracking and analytics tools.

Demonstrated success in managing and growing affiliate programs.

Benefits:



Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.

Hours on average will be 7a - 2P Pacific Time (M-F). Remote based.

Professional development opportunities.

Collaborative and dynamic work environment.



If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for affiliate marketing and lead generation, we invite you to join our team.



To apply, please submit the following:

*Resume

*Detail your specific experience in managing lead generation affiliates.

*What SaaS systems have you used in managing lead generation affiliates?

*Audio or video clip explaining why you are best qualified for the position.

title: Twilio Setup
description:
Twilio Studio & API Integration Specialist (Immediate Start – $9/hour)



Overview



We are seeking a Twilio Studio and API Integration Specialist to configure, deploy, and integrate Twilio services into our custom software platform. This role requires hands-on experience with Twilio Studio, Twilio APIs, and the ability to collaborate directly with our software developer to establish secure, scalable communication workflows.



This is a technical implementation role involving automation, voice, SMS, and API connectivity. The ideal candidate must be able to begin immediately.



?



Compensation

 • Pay: $9.00 USD per hour

 • Schedule: Part-time to full-time depending on performance and project needs

 • Start Date: Immediate



?



Core Responsibilities



Twilio Studio Configuration

 • Design and deploy Twilio Studio flows for inbound and outbound calls

 • Configure SMS messaging workflows, auto-responses, and routing logic

 • Build IVR systems with call routing, voi
 handling, and conditional logic

 • Implement automated call handling and escalation procedures



API Integration

 • Connect Twilio services to custom software using Twilio REST APIs

 • Work directly with our software developer to ensure proper integration and authentication

 • Configure webhooks and ensure reliable communication between systems

 • Assist with integration of voice, SMS, and notification systems



System Configuration and Testing

 • Configure Twilio phone numbers, messaging services, and routing rules

 • Perform functional testing of call flows, messaging, and API integrations

 • Troubleshoot connectivity, webhook, and API issues

 • Ensure reliable and efficient system operation



?



Required Qualifications



Candidates must have demonstrable experience with:

 • Twilio Studio flow creation and deployment

 • Twilio REST API integration

 • Webhooks and API connectivity

 • Voice and SMS implementation within Twilio

 • Working alongside software developers in an integration environment

 • Reading and understanding API documentation



?



Technical Skills Required

 • Twilio Studio

 • Twilio REST API

 • Webhooks

 • API authentication (API keys, tokens, etc.)

 • JSON and HTTP requests

 • Basic troubleshooting and debugging



Preferred but not required:

 • Experience integrating Twilio with custom CRM or internal software

 • Experience with automation platforms

 • Experience working with AI-driven communication systems



?



Communication Requirements



This role requires strong communication skills. You must be able to:

 • Clearly communicate technical issues and solutions

 • Follow instructions precisely

 • Provide regular updates on progress

 • Collaborate effectively with a software developer



Fluent English communication is required.



?



Work Environment

 • Remote position

 • Must have reliable internet

 • Must be available for real-time coordination during setup



?



Immediate Need



We are ready to begin implementation immediately. Qualified candidates who can start right away will be given priority.



?



To Apply



Please include the following:

 1. Summary of your Twilio experience

 2. Description of Twilio Studio flows you have built

 3. Description of Twilio API integrations you have completed

 4. Confirmation that you can start immediately

 5. Your hourly rate confirmation of $9/hour

title: EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT – Communications & Outreach (Property Management Company) [REMOTE]
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**

We’re a close, family-like U.S. long-term rental company looking for a sharp, resourceful, people-savvy Executive Assistant to support day-to-day operations. We’re hiring someone with proven, long-term professional experience — in any field. This is NOT an entry-level position.



We’ll train you on the “what” — but we need you to bring the “how.” That means:

**Thinking on your feet

**Solving problems before they escalate

**Speaking English clearly and confidently on the phone

**Caring about the business like it’s your own



We value people who treat the business like they’re part of it — not just clocking hours. If you’re the kind of person who goes the extra mile because you take pride in doing great work, you’ll thrive here.



**WHAT YOU’LL ACTUALLY DO**

• Be a reliable, professional point of contact for current tenants

• Manage lease renewals and ongoing tenant communication

• Make phone calls to gather info, follow up, and resolve issues

• Coordinate tasks, track details, and prevent things from falling through the cracks

• Help solve problems independently — and escalate only when needed

• Keep the owner organized and focused



-> This is not a checklist-following job. It’s a *thinking* role for someone who can move fast, stay calm, and figure things out.



**WHO THIS ROLE IS PERFECT FOR**

• *You speak clearly, confidently, and professionally in English — especially on calls*

• You’re a natural problem solver who can handle unexpected challenges without panic

• You think fast, take initiative, and don’t need hand-holding

• You genuinely care about the quality of your work and the business you’re supporting

• You’re someone who prepares, researches, and shows up ready

• You value long-term stability and being part of a trusted team



-> No property management or sales experience required

-> *Training provided — but success in this role depends on your ability to communicate smoothly and handle live conversations with clarity and confidence*



**WORK SCHEDULE**

This is Remote (Work from Home – must have reliable computer & internet)

• Full-time (40 hours/week) | Independent Contractor

• You choose your exact working hours, but must be reachable and responsive during U.S. Pacific Time business hours (7 AM – 7 PM, Mon–Fri), with active work occurring within that window



**COMPENSATION & GROWTH**

*Base pay up to $800/month to start,* with performance-based increases and bonuses for reliability, initiative, and strong work ethic.

Long-term role with real stability — no short-term rentals, no Airbnb chaos

Direct collaboration with the business owner — your work will actually make a difference



**FROM A CURRENT TEA
MBER**

“Working with Heavenly Happy Homes over the past year has been an experience I am truly blessed and grateful for. It has indeed been life-changing. From the very beginning, I felt trusted, supported, and encouraged to do my best. That kind of environment makes a huge difference, especially when working remotely. After going through uncertainty in a previous role, I was really praying to find a company where I could grow, learn, and feel secure long-term. Heavenly Happy Homes turned out to be exactly that and more. You genuinely find yourself loving the company and sincerely caring about the work you do. The culture here is respectful and collaborative, and everyone truly wants to see each other succeed. Even as a remote team, there is a strong sense of teamwork and shared purpose, which I honestly love. Training is efficient and well guided. R.S. helped me a lot, especially in understanding processes clearly. Another thing I can sincerely say is that hard work here never goes unnoticed. It is always valued and genuinely appreciated. Our boss is truly a wonderful employer!”



**HOW TO APPLY**

Submit your application here: 

Applications through OLJ may not be considered. Please complete the application at the link in this post.

title: Shopify Developer
description:
Shopify Developer (Maintenance & Customization)



Company: Metpure Inc. (US-based e-commerce company)

Work Type: Remote

Schedule: Part-time with long-term work (with potential to grow)

Time Zone: Flexible, but must communicate during US business hours



About the Role:



We are looking for a reliable Shopify Developer to handle ongoing Shopify development, maintenance, and improvements for our live production store.



This role is focused on execution, stability, and accuracy. You will implement changes based on clear instructions, best-practice checklists, and documented requirements, with an emphasis on protecting site performance and conversion stability.



Clear instructions and priorities will be provided for each task; therefore this position is ideal for a developer who prefers structured tasks, clear boundaries, and long-term stability.



Primary Responsibilities:



- Maintain and customize Shopify themes using Liquid, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

- Implement site updates and improvements exactly as specified

- Audit pages for basic best-practice compliance and fix clear issues

- Support:

• Product pages

• Collection pages

• Navigation and menus

• Product filters and tags

- Clean up and organize tags, collections, and metafields when instructed

- Install, configure, and maintain Shopify apps

- Identify and resolve theme or app conflicts

- Ensure mobile responsiveness and cross-browser compatibility

- Test all changes thoroughly before publishing

- Maintain theme backups before major changes

- Execute tasks on time and on schedule



What This Job Is NOT:



- No ad management

- No SEO or marketing strategy

- No graphic design or branding

- No business decision-making

- No content writing

- This is a technical Shopify execution role only.



Required Skills:



- Strong experience with Shopify (Liquid)

- Solid knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

- Experience working on live Shopify stores

- Attention to detail and cautious deployment habits

- Ability to follow instructions and documented processes

- Clear communication and reliability

- Strong organizational skills and task tracking

- Ability to execute tasks on time and within scope

- Good habits of checking work and testing changes after implementation



Nice to Have:



- Shopify speed optimization experience

- Metafields and custom sections

- Experience with inventory-heavy e-commerce stores



Work Expectations:



- Task-based assignments

- Changes documented before/after

- Ask questions before making risky changes

- Stable, long-term mindset preferred

- Great communication skill

- Available during US business hours to respond to urgent or time-sensitive issues affecting the live store.



To Apply, Please Answer:



1. Shopify Experience

Please share links to Shopify stores you have worked on and briefly describe what you worked on.

2. Strongest Skill

What is your strongest Shopify skill (theme work, debugging, structure, performance, etc.)?

3. Live Store Process

What is your process for making changes to a live Shopify store?

4. Following Instructions

If you are given specific instructions but think a different approach may be better, what do you do?

5. Testing Habits

What do you test before and after publishing changes?

6. UI / Conversion Safety

Name 2–3 elements on a product page you would never change without approval.

7. Unclear Requests

If a task is unclear or could impact checkout or conversion, what is your next step?

8. Availability & Setup

Please share your weekly availability, expected hourly rate, internet speed (download/upload), and backup plan.

title: Virtual Operations & Royalty Reporting Assistant
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Schedule: Full-time (~40 hours/week), flexible schedule to be coordinated

Compensation: $5.00 USD/hour

Reports to: Co-Founder

________________________________________



About the Role



Newport Knits is a high-end custom knitwear brand specializing in licensed collegiate apparel for over 65 schools. We manufacture premium fan gear and operate across direct-to-consumer and wholesale channels.

We are seeking a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support royalty reporting, customer communication, and operational organization. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, enjoys bringing structure to unorganized workflows, and is confident working with data and spreadsheets.

title: Financial Controller
description:
The Financial Controller is a key leadership position responsible for managing the company’s accounting operations with a focus on high-level accuracy and compliance across multiple jurisdictions. A primary requirement for this role is a deep understanding of US Financial Standards, enabling the individual to bridge local financial reporting with US GAAP requirements. This role is essential for organizations operating as shared services, BPOs, or subsidiaries of US-based entities, ensuring that all financial data is "investor-ready" and compliant with international standards.





II. Key Duties & Accountabilities



US GAAP Alignment: Manage the conversion of local financial statements to US GAAP standards for monthly and year-end closing.

Global Consolidation: Oversee the consolidation of financial results across different regions, ensuring consistency in accounting treatments and revenue recognition.

Taxation Knowledge: Provide oversight on US Federal tax principles and how they interact with local tax laws (e.g., withholding taxes, VAT/Sales tax nexus, and treaty benefits).

Internal Controls: Implement and monitor internal control frameworks that meet international best practices (such as SOX-lite environments) to ensure data integrity.

Reporting & Analysis: Prepare comprehensive financial packages for US-based stakeholders, including P&L analysis, balance sheet reconciliations, and cash flow projections.

Audit Coordination: Lead the coordination with external auditors who perform audits under AICPA or PCAOB standards.

Currency & Treasury: Manage multi-currency transactions and provide analysis on the impact of exchange rate fluctuations on the US Dollar reporting.

Process Automation: Leverage accounting software (e.g., NetSuite, Sage, or QuickBooks US) to automate reporting and reduce manual errors in international accounting.



III. Minimum Hiring Requirements



Proven Experience: 8+ years of experience in Finance/Accounting, with at least 3–5 years specifically handling US Financial reporting or US-based clients.

Technical Knowledge: Strong working knowledge of US GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles) is mandatory. Familiarity with ASC 606 (Revenue Recognition) is a plus.

Professional Certification: Certified Public Accountant (CPA). Exposure to US CPA or CMA curricula is highly preferred.

Systems Proficiency: Experience with Cloud ERPs that support US accounting modules (e.g., NetSuite, SAP Business One, or Microsoft Dynamics 365).

Industry Background: Experience in industries with heavy US ties, such as IT Services, SaaS, BPO, or Multinational Manufacturing.

Analytical Skills: Ability to perform complex financial analysis and translate local financial performance into terms understandable to US executives.

Communication: Excellent command of the English language, both written and verbal, for reporting to international management.

s and keep conversations moving forward

 (Gmail/GSuite)

 drops

s



Compensation

pillars

weekly themes

captions/subtitles consistent with brand

story keyword flows

Must-have proof

Compensation (we’re flexible for the right operator)

A Loom video (2–3 min max) introducing yourself

Your updated CV, LinkedIn, or personal site

A few lines on why you’re the perfect fit for this role

title: Accountant
description:
Key Responsibilities



1. Bookkeeping & Financial Organization



Clean up, organize, and reconcile all financial records from Jan 2024 – current.



Maintain accurate daily, weekly, and monthly bookkeeping.



Track all income, expenses, invoices, reimbursements, and owner draws.



Prepare monthly financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow).



Maintain chart of accounts according to best practices for LLC/S-Corp and home care operations.



Categorize all transactions correctly in QuickBooks Online.



2. Payroll Processing



Manage payroll for employees and contractors using QuickBooks or integrated systems.



Ensure compliance with Texas workforce laws and home care wage requirements.



Track and file payroll reports, wage records, and year-end documents (W-2, 1099).



Reconcile payroll tax deposits and filings.



3. Tax Preparation & Compliance



Prepare and maintain records for quarterly estimated tax payments.



Support S-Corp election tracking, filings, and compliance requirements.



Ensure proper categorization of business vs. personal expenses.



Work with CPA (if applicable) to prepare:



Annual corporate tax return (1120-S)



Personal return support (Schedule K-1)



Franchise tax filings



Sales tax (if applicable)



4. Home Care Financial Compliance



Maintain financial documentation required for HHSC PAS, Medicaid waiver programs, and private-pay audits.



Track client payments, caregiver payroll hours, deposits, and service billing.



Help prepare financials for licensing renewals, audits, and accreditation needs.



5. Strategic Financial Support



Create budgeting, forecasting, and cash-flow tracking tools.



Advise on financial workflows to improve efficiency and reduce cost.



Prepare financial reports for Chamber partnerships, grants, and funding opportunities.



Support nonprofit financial separation for Houston Birthing Connection if needed.



Qualifications



3+ years experience in bookkeeping, payroll, and small business taxes.



Required: QuickBooks Online proficiency.



Strong understanding of LLC/S-Corp taxation, accounting rules, and compliance.



Experience in home care, healthcare operations, or service-based businesses preferred.



Ability to independently clean up outdated or disorganized records.



High integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism.



Strong communication skills and ability to explain finances in plain language.



Preferred Skills



Knowledge of HHSC PAS compliance and home care billing.



Experience preparing documents for grants, lenders, and compliance audits.



Ability to implement financial systems, templates, and workflows.



Familiarity with nonprofit bookkeeping (optional but a plus).



Compensation



Based on experience and project scope (cleanup + ongoing monthly bookkeeping).



Opportunity for long-term as the company grows.

title: Grant/ Proposal Writer for Houston Birthing Connection
description:
Grant Writer



Houston Birthing Connection

Remote

Part-Time or Contract



Houston Birthing Connection is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit dedicated to supporting teen parents, young adults aging out of foster care, and at-risk youth. We provide transitional housing, parenting education, life skills, workforce development, case management, financial literacy, emotional support, and pathways to independence.



We are looking for an experienced Grant Writer who can help us secure funding to expand our programs, strengthen our impact in the community, and support the youth and families we serve.





 Responsibilities



* Research federal, state, county, foundation, and corporate funding opportunities

* Write compelling grant proposals, letters of intent, capability statements, and narratives

* Prepare budgets, program descriptions, and required documentation

* Work directly with the Executive Director to gather data, reports, and program outcomes

* Maintain a grant calendar, deadlines, and submission timeline

* Edit and improve existing proposals such as our HBC Transitional Housing Program and Youth Workforce Pathways

* Identify new opportunities for housing grants, youth grants, workforce development grants, rural development grants, and community impact funding

* Assist with reporting requirements after grants are awarded

* Develop proposals that strengthen HBC’s programs including:



  * Transitional housing

  * Teen parent support

  * Parenting and life skills

  * Workforce and career development

  * Case management

  * Financial literacy

  * Early childhood support

  * Community partnerships with schools and local agencies







# Qualifications



* Proven experience writing successful grants for nonprofits

* Strong understanding of youth programs, family services, transitional housing, workforce development, or human services

* Excellent writing, research, and communication skills

* Ability to translate program goals into fundable language

* Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines

* Experience creating budgets and grant attachments is preferred

* Knowledge of federal and state grants is a plus

* Must be reliable, organized, and able to manage multiple submissions at once







# What We Offer

title: In Home Non Medical Home Care Social Media and Content Manager
description:
In Home Non Medical Home Care Social Media and Content Manager



21st Century Quality Home Care

Houston, Surrounding Counties, and Tyler, Texas

Part-Time or Contract Role



21st Century Quality Home Care is a licensed non-medical home care agency serving seniors, disabled adults, veterans, and families in Houston, surrounding counties, and Tyler, Texas. We specialize in providing compassionate care to individuals living with Alzheimer’s, dementia, chronic illness, and those who need daily living support.



We are hiring a Social Media and Content Manager who understands how to grow engagement, educate the community, and help families connect with the services they desperately need. We need more than basic reels. We need someone who can produce clear, powerful, and trustworthy content that speaks to seniors, adult children, caregivers, and health care partners.





 What You Must Do Before Applying



Applicants will only be considered after completing all steps.



1. Visit and review our
 page: 21st Century Quality Home Care.

   Evaluate our current visuals, tone, posting frequency, and engagement.



2. Submit a short explanation of:



   * How you will educate the community about Alzheimer’s and dementia care

   * How you will explain the new Medicare GUIDE Program (80 hours of free respite care for eligible patients with traditional Medicare)

   * How you will connect with caregivers who feel overwhelmed, stressed, or unsupported

   * How you plan to increase real engagement, followers, and leads

   * What type of reels you will create to build trust and authority in the home care space



3. Like the page so we can add you as a content manager.







 Key Responsibilities



* Create a complete content strategy for
, Instagram, and TikTok

* Produce educational content about Alzheimer’s, dementia, and senior care

* Create reels explaining the new Medicare GUIDE Program in clear and simple language

* Post weekly service highlights for Houston and Tyler, Texas

* Create caregiver-focused posts that offer support, tips, and encouragement

* Share information about respite care, supervised visits, companionship, housekeeping, meal support, mobility help, and safety monitoring

* Build campaigns that target adult children caring for aging parents

* Design high-quality graphics that match the 21st Century Quality Home Care brand

* Write captions that encourage families to reach out for help

* Increase page engagement, reach, and community awareness

* Track analytics and adjust strategy based on results

Most important Long term Care insurance pays for in home non medical care and we must to reach on the different whole life insurance plans. See below. 

Here are a few real-world examples to present to clients:



Texas Life Insurance Company: Their product (SBBC-Overview) includes an Accelerated Death Benefit Rider for terminal illness for no added premium. But note: this is for terminal illness, and may not cover non-medical home care or custodial care in the way your clients need. 

Texas Life



Texas Republic Life Insurance Company (“TrueFlex” product): Includes a Chronic Care Rider: you can accelerate 45 % of death benefit if unable to perform 2 of the 6 ADLs or have severe cognitive impairment; paid out over 24-months. This is closer to what you might need (custodial/home care) though you’d check if “non-medical home care services” are eligible. 

Texas Republic Life Insurance Company



Generic “life insurance with LTC rider” info: For example, the article from Progressive Casualty Insurance Company describes how an LTC rider is added to whole/universal life policy and allows early life insurance death benefits for long-term care expenses such as home health care worker. 

Progressive



???? How to Position This for Your Agency



Since your agency provides non-medical home care services, here are ways you can make this relevant for your clients and your business:



Client education: Create a one-pager or workshop for your clients (or prospects) explaining: “How your life insurance policy could be used to fund home care,” outlining what to ask their insurance agent (rider type, ADL triggers, home care coverage, assignment options).



Referral network: Consider partnering or building relationships with local life-insurance brokers/agents in Texas who specialise in “living-benefits” riders or life insurance + LTC hybrid products. They can refer clients who have policies that might match your services.



Intake workflow: When onboarding a client who says they’ll use a life-insurance rider, include in your intake: copy of the policy benefit summary, rider details, underwriting criteria (ADLs, etc), assignment letter or provider payment options, verification of your agency as eligible provider under that policy (if needed).



Representation & documentation: Ensure that your service agreement with the client explicitly describes the non-medical home care services you provide; keep detailed care logs, ADL progress/decline if applicable, so the insurer’s trigger conditions (e.g., inability to perform 2 ADLs) are documented.



Clarify expectations: Because many policies may only cover skilled care vs. pure non-medical companion/homemaker care, ensure the client understands potential gaps and payment responsibilities if the policy doesn’t cover exactly what your services include.





What We Are Looking For



* Someone who can create content that builds trust and authority

* Experience in caregiving, health care, senior care, dementia care,  and Veterans benefits for cover the cost of non medical home care

* Strong skills in short-form video editing, social storytelling, health education, and community engagement

* Ability to turn complex information into simple, family-friendly content

* Someone who understands how to create reels that get shared

* A creative thinker who understands the emotional side of caregiving



You must know how to produce content that speaks to:



* Family caregivers

* Spouses caring for loved ones

* Adult children overwhelmed by caregiving demands

* Seniors who want to age safely at home

* People worried about memory loss, confusion, or dementia progression



We want someone who can make our content feel real, compassionate, and helpful.





About 21st Century Quality Home Care



We provide:



* Non-medical in-home care

* Alzheimer’s and dementia support

* Respite care

* Personal care and bathing assistance

* Companionship

* Medication reminders

* Light housekeeping

* Meal preparation

* Mobility assistance

* Safety and fall prevention

* Support for family caregivers

* Referrals for the Medicare GUIDE Program (80 hours of support for eligible seniors with traditional Medicare)



We serve seniors who want to remain at home with dignity, safety, and comfort.





 To Apply



Send:



1. Your strategy for growing our presence and explaining the GUIDE Program

2. Samples of reels or educational content you have created

3. Three reel ideas specifically for Alzheimer’s, dementia, or caregiver support

4. Your availability

title: Part-Time Tiktok / UGC Editor
description:
Editing VA hiring post:



Part-time Capcut / UGC / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcup or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

Cutting dead space in talking head videos

Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.





Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.







B-roll content - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.





Very basic content - this will take up a majority of your workload and will consist of usually one main video thats about 5-10 minutes long, 1-2 photos that need to be addressed, and maybe a request to add a caption.





You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

Attention to detail

STRONG English

Strong internet connection

Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

Good working with a team

Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

Availability to work 3-4h a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

PH or similar time zone

To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (1h max)



Below is a Google drive with the original files you will need to re-create this reference video:



Reference video: one reference video is in the google drive upper "edited chest" and then here is the link to the other: 



Google drive:

Download the files and import into your video editing software

Find the “good” takes of the audio sections and stitch together to complete the voiceover

title: Digital Media Specialist
description:
Part-Time Social Media & Meta Ads Specialist (Shopify Brand)



TO APPLY — PLEASE FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY



1.) Your CV must be in **PDF format** with file name:

**Full Name + Digital Media Specialist**

2.) Portfolio link for **Graphic Works** (visuals or videos — published works preferred) – **REQUIRED**

3.) Portfolio link showing **Ad Campaign Tractions / Results** – **REQUIRED**



---



About the Role



You will manage our platforms end-to-end — from content creation to paid ads strategy — ensuring everything aligns with our Shopify store and drives measurable sales results.



We need someone confident, proactive, and capable of leading execution without daily direction.



---

Requirements



* At least 1 year PROVEN in Social Media & Meta Ads management

* Proven experience running and optimizing
 & Instagram ad campaigns

* Strong understanding of campaign structure, audience targeting, retargeting, and scaling

* Experience working with Shopify brands (preferred)

* Strong branding and creative direction skills

* Experience creating short-form video content (Reels/TikTok-style)

* Proficient in tools such as Canva, CapCut, Meta Ads Manager, and Google Workspace

* Ability to analyze KPIs (CTR, CPA, ROAS, conversions) and make data-driven decisions





Bonus:

*
 marketing experience (Klaviyo, Mailchimp)

* Basic SEO and product page optimization knowledge



---



Key Responsibilities



Social Media Management

* Create, schedule, and publish feed posts, stories, and reels

* Write engaging captions and produce/select on-brand visuals

* Maintain consistent brand identity and messaging

* Monitor and respond to comments and DMs

* Escalate customer service issues when needed



Meta Ads Management

* Set up, launch, and manage
 & Instagram ad campaigns

* Handle targeting, budget allocation, creative testing, and scaling

* Continuously optimize campaigns based on performance

* Monitor KPIs (reach, engagement, CTR, conversions, CPA, ROAS)

* Adjust content and campaigns based on insights



Role Details



* Part-Time

* Tuesday–Thursday (Flexible Hours)

* $4–$6 USD/hour (based on experience)

* Long-term opportunity for the right candidate



We’re looking for someone who brings both creativity and performance strategy to the table — someone who takes ownership and genuinely enjoys building brands that convert.



If that sounds like you, we’d love to see your application!

title: Sr Media Buyer
description:

As we continue to grow, we're seeking a Senior Media Buyer who shares our passion for creativity and innovation to join our dynamic team.Are you a seasoned media buyer with a passion for creativity and innovation? Do you thrive on staying ahead of the curve, constantly seeking out new trends and pushing the boundaries of what's possible? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!



Key Responsibilities:

? Develop and execute cutting-edge media buying strategies that leverage the latest trends and best creatives, tailored specifically for the USA market.

? Stay ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies, constantly seeking out new opportunities for innovation.

 your resume and MedSpa portfolio at

title: Lead Generation - Permanent WFH
description:
We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented Lead Generation Specialist to drive consistent and high-quality leads from hospitals across the United States. This in-house role will be responsible for

identifying, researching, and engaging decision-makers in the healthcare industry to support our sales and marketing goals. 



The ideal candidate has experience in
 outreach, understands hospital industry dynamics, and is capable of creating and executing campaigns that align with our brand voice while building trust and opening conversations with qualified prospects. 



 



???? Key Responsibilities: 



Identify and build lists of verified hospital contacts based on our target audience (specific roles, titles, and regions). 

Conduct manual research to validate contact information and relevance. 

Develop tailored outreach messaging based on pain points and campaign objectives. 

Execute
 campaigns using platforms like SendGrid (aligned with Odoo). 

Monitor, manage, and respond to lead replies to nurture them through the pipeline. 

Maintain a consistent tone and messaging aligned with the Cube Care brand. 

Track campaign performance and report on lead quality, objections, and interest. 

Collaborate with sales and marketing to refine messaging and target segments. 

Ensure compliance with
 marketing best practices to avoid blacklisting, especially with healthcare servers. 

 



???? Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): 



Number of verified hospital contacts added monthly (target: 300+). 

Number of high-quality, engaged leads generated (target: 10–15 per month). 

 open rate (target: >35%) and reply rate (target: >8%). 

Number of
 campaigns executed per quarter (target: 2–3). 

Conversion rate from lead to opportunity (measured jointly with sales). 

Timely reporting and insights provided weekly. 

Consistency in messaging and alignment with brand tone and values. 

 



???? Requirements: 



Proven experience in lead generation, sales development, or
 outreach (healthcare industry preferred). 

Strong research skills and attention to detail. 

Familiarity with tools like SendGrid, Odoo (or similar CRM) 

Clear, persuasive written communication skills. 

Ability to work independently and manage time effectively. 

Comfortable handling large data lists and segmenting based on target criteria. 

 



???? Preferred: 



Prior experience generating leads within hospitals or the healthcare industry. 

Experience integrating CRM data for outreach and reporting. 







System Requirements:



Computer Processor: Minimum 5th generation Intel i5 processor or equivalent

Computer Memory/RAM: Minimum 4.00 GB

Computer Operating System: Windows 10 or Mac OSX - No Linux, Unix, or any operating system other than what is required.

Internet Speed: Running on a 5.0 MBPS plan or higher (Both primary and backup) - If your backup connection cannot serve as your primary connection, that does not qualify as a backup connection

REQUIRED Headset: Noise-cancelling headset connected via USB port

REQUIRED WebCam: At least 3 megapixels capable of 720p recording

title: Autocaller AI Expert
description:
Role Overview



Join Autocaller AI, where cutting-edge technology meets traditional operational discipline. We are seeking an AI Automation Expert with mastery in GoHighLevel (GHL), workflows, automation, Make, and N8N to architect, execute, and optimize client automation systems.



In this role, you will onboard new clients using our structured training process, configure end-to-end CRM and call automation workflows, and drive operational excellence across AI-powered pipelines. If you thrive at the intersection of precision and innovation, this is your stage.



Key Responsibilities



Client Onboarding Excellence: Deliver seamless, repeatable onboarding sessions guided by our proven training scripts.



GHL System Management: Build, refine, and monitor funnels, pipelines, triggers, tags, and automations.



Autocaller AI Execution: Deploy and optimize AI-driven outbound/inbound calling workflows that qualify leads, schedule appointments, and ensure rapid follow-up.



Workflow Integration: Leverage Make and N8N to connect systems, streamline processes, and eliminate inefficiencies.



Prompt & Script Development: Translate strategy into persuasive AI prompts and voice scripts that boost conversion rates.



Analytics & Reporting: Track key funnel, pipeline, and campaign metrics to guide data-driven improvements.



Quality & Compliance: Maintain consistency, best practices, and client satisfaction with meticulous oversight.



Qualifications



GHL Expertise – Proven experience with funnels, campaigns, workflows, triggers, and advanced automation.



Automation Tools – Hands-on experience with Make and N8N for system integrations.



AI & Dialer Tools – Familiarity with Autocaller AI, PowerDialer, or comparable AI calling platforms.



Scriptwriting & Prompt Engineering – Ability to craft prompts and scripts that convert.



Data-Driven Mindset – Skilled at reading analytics, spotting bottlenecks, and optimizing workflows.



Client Training – Professional, confident, and clear in delivering onboarding and support.



Communication – Excellent written and verbal communication skills.



Mindset – Reliable, forward-thinking, and disciplined, with respect for structured systems.



Why Join Us?



At Autocaller AI, we’re not just building workflows—we’re reshaping the way businesses engage leads. This is an opportunity to lead in a space where tradition meets innovation, and where your systems-thinking drives real-world results.



If you’re ready to merge creativity with operational rigor and help redefine the future of AI-powered client engagement—we’d love to hear from you.



How To Apply:

Please send us a message with the SUBJECT: AI Automation Expert



NOTE: You will be given a test task to gauge your skills competency on the role. Please do not apply if you cannot complete the test task. We are only hiring experts and highly-professional individuals for this role.

title: Certified Public Accountant (CPA) - REMOTE
description:
We are a US-based custom manufacturing company, and we are looking for dedicated and loyal individuals that can contribute to our goals. We are looking for individuals who Embodies Our Core Values, Serve Others and Own It!



We are looking for Certified Public Accountants!



Key Responsibilities:

- Analyze, organize, update financial records.

- Perform regular, detailed audits to ensure accuracy in financial documents, expenditures, and investments.

- Perform daily reconciliation of credit card, bank accounts, cash accounts, spending accounts, etc.

- Setup financial accounts as needed.

- Oversee ledger reconciliation and manage accounts payable/receivables.

- Liaise with Tax Accountants to track tax payments and returns.

- Monitor bookkeeping activities regularly.

- Keep company financial information confidential.

- Ensure vendor accounts are kept up to date for the entire organization.

- Inventory Management

- China Purchase Management



Qualifications:

- Excellent FLUENT English verbal and written communication.

- Candidate must possess at least Bachelor’s/College Degree in relevant field.

- Proven work experience as a Certified Public Accountant (CPA).

- Understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).

- Preferably experienced accounting/finance employees specializing in US Accounting System.

- Familiarity with accounting applications, modules, and financial statements.

- Motivation to exceed expectations while working independently

- Friendly, fast learner who can adapt to change and have a “can-do” attitude

- Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office, Outlook, Google, Internet Explorer, Microsoft Teams, etc.



System Requirements:

- Computer Processor: Minimum 5th generation Intel i5 processor or equivalent

- Computer Memory/RAM: Minimum 4.00 GB

- Computer Operating System: Windows 10 or Mac OSX - No Linux, Unix, or any operating system other than what is required.

- Internet Speed: Running on a 5.0 MBPS plan or higher (Both primary and backup) - If your backup connection cannot serve as your primary connection, that does not qualify as a backup connection

- REQUIRED Headset: Noise-cancelling headset connected via USB port

- REQUIRED WebCam: At least 3 megapixels capable of 720p recording



***We’re picky. You must be smart, savvy, strategic, fun, and ready to learn fast and work hard. If you’re up for the challenge, we want to hear from you!

title: Bookkeeper (AR)
description:
The Bookkeeper (Accounts Receivable) will be responsible for managing and maintaining accurate AR records, ensuring timely invoicing, collections, and payment application. This role plays a key part in maintaining healthy cash flow and supporting Cube Care’s financial accuracy and reporting.



The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, and comfortable working with customers, internal teams, and financial data in a fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities



Accounts Receivable

Prepare, issue, and track customer invoices accurately and on time

Monitor accounts receivable aging and follow up on outstanding balances

Apply customer payments (checks, ACH, wire, credit cards) to the correct accounts

Resolve billing discrepancies, short payments, and unapplied credits

Communicate professionally with customers regarding invoices, payments, and account status



Bookkeeping & Financial Support

Maintain accurate AR records in the accounting system

Assist with month-end closing activities related to receivables

Reconcile AR sub-ledgers to the general ledger

Support audits and provide AR documentation as needed

Collaborate with sales, operations, and customer service teams to ensure billing accuracy



Process Improvement

Identify opportunities to improve AR processes and collection efficiency

Help maintain clear documentation of billing and AR procedures



Qualifications



Must be based in the Philippines

Proven experience as a Bookkeeper or Accounts Receivable Specialist

Strong understanding of accounts receivable processes and basic accounting principles

Experience working with invoicing, collections, and reconciliations

Proficiency with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, NetSuite, or similar systems)

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to manage multiple accounts and deadline



Preferred Qualifications



Experience in healthcare, B2B, or service-based industries

Familiarity with hospital or large institutional billing processes

Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

Experience supporting U.S. customers while working offshore



System Requirements



Processor: Minimum 5th-generation Intel i5 or equivalent

Memory: Minimum 4 GB RAM

Operating System: Windows 10 or Mac OSX

Internet: Minimum 5.0 Mbps primary connection with reliable backup

Headset: USB noise-cancelling headset (required)

Webcam: Minimum 3 MP, capable of 720p recording



Why Join Cube Care?



Support a U.S.-based manufacturing company while working remotely from the Philippines

Play a critical role in financial accuracy and compliance

Clear ownership and accountability in your role

Long-term opportunity with a values-driven company

Collaborative environment with leadership visibility



Culture Fit



We maintain high standards. We value professionals who are detail-driven, accountable, strategic, and eager to learn. If you take ownership of your work and thrive in a fast-moving environment, we want to hear from you.



___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Please create an application on this link to be considered: 
==

title: Inbound TeleSales Closer (High-Ticket) - Luxury Yacht Bookings
description:
We operate in the luxury yacht rental & events space. We are hiring a Senior / Expert Sales Closer to convert high-intent, pre-qualified leads into paid bookings.



Leads are already qualified and sent to you with the necessary details. Your role is to:



- confirm remaining details,



- answer final questions,



- handle objections professionally,



- secure payment by sending the invoice and closing by phone and in writing.



This is a role for someone who is highly driven, very available, and extremely detail-oriented. Our process includes administrative execution (accuracy matters).



Key Responsibilities



Close pre-qualified inbound leads via phone and written communication (chat/email/WhatsApp follow-up).



Convert both:



- short-cycle deals (minutes), and



- longer-cycle deals (days/weeks, when needed).



Send invoices and ensure payment is secured to confirm the booking.



Manage follow-ups with discipline until the lead is closed or clearly disqualified.



Maintain strong administrative standards:



- clean notes, accurate deal status,



- clear next steps and reminders,



- zero missed follow-ups.



Communicate clearly with the team to ensure a smooth handoff once payment is received.



Requirements (Non?Negotiable)



Proven experience as a Sales Closer.



Strong closing skills on the phone and in writing.



Comfortable closing high-ticket transactions (our deals range from $2,000 up to $500,000).



Professional English (spoken + written).



High responsiveness and availability (this is critical for inbound, high-intent leads).



Very strong attention to detail and reliability.



Stable internet, headset, and a quiet working environment.



Nice to Have



Experience in luxury, travel, hospitality, concierge, events, or premium services.



Experience handling high-net-worth clients with confidence, discretion, and professionalism.



Ability to manage negotiation calmly (value framing, urgency, clarity, objections).



Compensation



Base: $
/month



Commission: per closed booking (details shared during interview)



OTE (monthly): $1,000 – $5,000 depending on performance

High performers will earn more. Consistency and professionalism are rewarded.



How to Apply (Important)



To apply, please send:



A short summary of your closing background:



what you sold, typical deal size,



phone closing experience,



written follow-up closing experience,



your strongest closing environment (inbound/outbound).



Your estimated close rate (or best realistic estimate) and weekly volume handled.



Optional but recommended: a short Loom (2–4 minutes) introducing yourself and explaining your closing approach.



Start your application with this keyword on the first line: YACHT-CLOSER

Internet Speed: Running on a 5.0 MBPS plan or higher (Both primary and backup) - If your backup connection cannot serve as your primary connection, that does not qualify as a backup connection

REQUIRED WebCam: At least 3 megapixels capable of 720p recording

title: Sales Representative
description:
We are a US-based custom manufacturing company, and we are looking for dedicated and loyal individuals that can contribute to our goals. We are looking for individuals who Embody Our Core Values, Serve Others and Own It!



We are looking for Sales Professionals!



Key Responsibilities:

- Identify and generate sales leads through prospecting, website inquiries, databases, cold-calling, and other promotional strategies.

- Schedule and conduct virtual meetings and presentations with potential clients.

- Develop and deliver compelling sales presentations on company products and services.

- Maintain accurate records of sales activities, prospects, and customer interactions in the company CRM.

- Track customer reorders and follow up to ensure continued satisfaction.

- Communicate customer and prospect product pain points to appropriate departments.

- Maintain a well-developed pipeline of prospects.

- Collaborate with internal teams to address customer pain points and improve offerings.

- Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with customers and prospect.

- Consistently meet or exceed sales quotas and performance targets.



Qualifications:

- Fluent in English (both verbal and written) with excellent communication skills.

- Proven success in sales, with a strong track record of meeting or exceeding quotas.

- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while maintaining high productivity.

- Strong relationship-building and negotiation skills.

- Self-motivated with a results-oriented mindset and a proactive approach.

- Friendly, fast learner who can adapt to change and have a “can-do” attitude

- Tech-savvy, with proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Suite, CRM software, and virtual communication tools (e.g., Microsoft Teams, Zoom).



System Requirements:

- Computer Processor: Minimum 5th generation Intel i5 processor or equivalent

- Computer Memory/RAM: Minimum 4.00 GB

- Computer Operating System: Windows 10 or Mac OSX - No Linux, Unix, or any operating system other than what is required.

- Internet Speed: Running on a 5.0 MBPS plan or higher (Both primary and backup) - If your backup connection cannot serve as your primary connection, that does not qualify as a backup connection

- REQUIRED Headset: Noise-cancelling headset connected via USB port

- REQUIRED WebCam: At least 3 megapixels capable of 720p recording



***We’re picky. You must be smart, savvy, strategic, fun, and ready to learn fast and work hard. If you’re up for the challenge, we want to hear from you!

title: ??  Hiring in next 24 hours - Cold Email Inbox Manager ??
description:
Cold
 Inbox Manager (Response Tagging Specialist)



Location: Remote

Schedule: Monday–Friday

Hours: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM (UK Time)

Total Hours: 35 hours per week

Starting Rate: $2–$3 per hour (based on experience)

Pay Increase: Performance-based review after onboarding



Overview

We are hiring a highly detail-oriented Cold
 Inbox Manager whose sole responsibility is to accurately tag and categorize incoming
 responses across multiple client campaigns.



This is a logic-based role. You will not be writing
s, closing deals, or managing clients. Your only job is to carefully read responses and apply the correct tag based on internal rules.



Accuracy is more important than speed.



?? We are hiring within the next 24 hours. Immediate availability is preferred ?? 





Core Responsibility

Your ONLY responsibility will be:



Reviewing incoming cold
 responses across multiple inboxes



Accurately tagging each response using internal criteria



Using logic and context to determine the correct classification



Maintaining consistency across all clients and campaigns



Examples of tags may include:

Interested

Not Interested

Referral

Out of Office

Wrong Person

Remove / Unsubscribe

Already Working with Provider

Price Objection

Spam / Irrelevant



(Full tagging SOP and training will be provided.)





Requirements

You MUST:

Have excellent English comprehension

Understand nuance, tone, and implied meaning

Think logically and follow structured systems

Maintain strong attention to detail

Be consistent and disciplined

Be reliable and punctual (start at 10AM UK time daily)

Be comfortable with repetitive but precise work





What This Role Is NOT

Not a sales role

Not a copywriting role

Not a creative role

Not a client-facing role

This is a focused execution role that requires precision and consistency.

Performance Expectations

High tagging accuracy

No guessing — follow guidelines and escalate edge cases

Consistent output throughout the full 7-hour shift

Strong reliability and attendance





Compensation & Growth

Starting pay: $2–$3 per hour (depending on experience and assessment performance)

35 hours per week

Pay increase after initial review period once performance and accuracy are verified

Long-term opportunity for consistent performers

We reward precision, consistency, and reliability.



How to Apply



To be considered, you must complete the following:

Record a short Loom video (2–3 minutes).



In the video:

Introduce yourself

Explain your previous experience (if any)

Confirm your availability from 10AM–5PM UK time, Monday to Friday

Briefly explain why you believe you would be good at a logic-based, detail-focused role



This video is required.



We are specifically assessing:

English fluency

Clarity of communication

Confidence and professionalism

Logical thinking ability

Only candidates with strong English-speaking ability will be selected for the next stage.



Shortlisted applicants will be invited to a group interview.

title: Amazon Wholesale Virtual Assistant (FBA Expert)
description:
Are you an Amazon Wholesale pro who knows how to spot winning products, build supplier relationships, and keep Seller Central running like a well-oiled machine? If you thrive in a fast-paced e-commerce environment and can work independently with confidence we want to hear from you. We’re looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Amazon Wholesale Virtual Assistant with hands-on experience in FBA, product sourcing, and wholesale account management. You’ll play a key role in scaling our Amazon business by researching profitable products, managing suppliers, and handling daily Seller Central operations.



What You’ll Be Doing



Research and identify profitable wholesale products

Contact and open accounts with brand owners, distributors, and wholesalers

Analyze products using tools like Keepa, SellerAmp (SAS), Helium 10, and similar

Create, prep, and manage FBA shipments

Monitor inventory levels, pricing, and stock health

Plan and manage restocks and replenishment

Handle Amazon Seller Central tasks (listings, uploads, cases, flat files, etc.)

Maintain accurate spreadsheets, reports, and documentation

Communicate professionally with suppliers and internal tea
mbers

Proven experience as an Amazon Wholesale VA

Strong understanding of the Amazon FBA workflow

Solid product research and data analysis skills

Hands-on experience with Keepa, SAS, Helium 10, or similar tools

Excellent English communication skills (written & verbal)

Self-motivated, organized, and able to work independently

Ability to meet deadlines with minimal supervision

Stable internet connection and reliable work setup



How to Apply

Send your Resume/CV and include a brief summary of your Amazon wholesale experience.
