title: Experienced Transaction Coordinator (Open to Close Required)
description:
Part-Time or Full-Time | Remote | U.S. Real Estate Team



We are a high-performing, growth-driven U.S. real estate team seeking an experienced Transaction Coordinator to support our agents and clients from contract to close. This is a long-term opportunity for someone who thrives in a structured, fast-paced, team environment and takes pride in accuracy, organization, and proactive communication.



Open to Close experience is required.

Bonus if you have experience with Matrix MLS and/or CTM contract software.



About Us

We operate as a collaborative team built on strong core values:

-Growth – We are always improving personally and professionally

-Urgency – We move quickly and proactively

-Integrity – We do the right thing, always

-Passion – We care deeply about our clients and our work

-Commitment – We follow through, no matter what



We are looking for someone who aligns with these values and wants to grow with a stable, long-term team.



Responsibilities:

-Manage transactions from executed contract through closing

-Create and maintain files in Open to Close

-Track and manage all contract deadlines (earnest money, inspection, appraisal, HOA docs, title deadlines, etc.)

-Communicate professionally with agents, lenders, title companies, and clients

-Ensure compliance and accuracy of all documents

-Upload, review, and manage contract documents in CTM (if experienced)

-Assist with MLS input and updates (Matrix MLS experience preferred)

-Monitor file status and proactively flag potential issues

-Coordinate amendments, inspection resolutions, and closing documents

-Maintain organized digital file systems

-Provide clear, consistent updates to the team



Qualifications

-Proven experience as a U.S. real estate Transaction Coordinator

-Required: Experience using Open to Close

-Strong understanding of U.S. real estate contracts and timelines

-High attention to detail and deadline management

-Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

-Ability to work independently and proactively

-Organized, systematic, and process-driven

-Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment

-Bonus Experience:

-Matrix MLS

-CTM (Contract to Close / eContracts)

-Experience working with real estate teams (not just individual agents)



What We’re Looking For

You are:

-Extremely detail-oriented

-Calm under pressure

-Proactive (you don’t wait to be told what to do)

-Comfortable managing multiple files at once

-A team player who communicates clearly and respectfully

-Committed to long-term stability



Schedule & Compensation

-Part-time or full-time available

-Must overlap with U.S. Mountain Time business hours

-Competitive pay based on experience

-Opportunity for long-term growth within our organization



To Apply Please include:

-A summary of your transaction coordination experience

-Your experience with Open to Close

-Any experience with Matrix MLS or CTM

-Your availability (hours per week and time zone)

-Why you believe you would be a strong fit for our team

title: Social Media Research Assistant – TikTok & Instagram Creator Research (Lymph by Path.)
description:
About Us



We’re building Lymph by Path., a wellness app designed to help women reduce bloating, improve lymphatic flow, and see real body changes using guided routines.



We’re looking for a reliable research assistant to help us find TikTok and Instagram creators in the vibration plate and wellness space.



This is a simple, repeatable research role with clear instructions and long-term growth opportunity.





Responsibilities



You will:



• Search TikTok and Instagram for creators

• Find creators who post about:

    •    vibration plates

    •    lymphatic drainage

    •    debloating

    •    wellness routines

    •    weight loss journeys



• Add creator information to a Google Sheet



This role will begin as research only.







Performance Expectations



You should find:



30 to 50 qualified creators per hour



Typical daily output:



• 150 to 300 creators per day

• 750 to 1,500 creators per week



We will provide training and examples.







Pay Structure



Research role:

$5 to $7 per hour



Expanded role (research + creator outreach):

$6 to $8 per hour



Strong performers will have the opportunity to grow into messaging and onboarding creators.







Opportunity for Growth



Top performers may expand into:



• Messaging creators on Instagram and TikTok

• Inviting creators to join the Lymph by Path. founding creator program

• Helping onboard creators



This provides long-term growth opportunity and increased hours.







Requirements



• Familiar with TikTok and Instagram

• Detail-oriented

• Reliable

• Able to follow instructions



No prior experience required.







Hours



4 to 8 hours per day

Flexible schedule



Long-term opportunity available.







How to Apply



Please answer:

    1.    How many hours per day can you work?

    2.    Have you used TikTok or Instagram before?

    3.    Find 3 TikTok creators who post about vibration plates and send the links.

title: Klaviyo Email Strategist and Copywriter
description:
Part time role that will eventually grow into a full time role. 



We’re a fast-growing
 marketing agency that helps ecommerce brands build retention and drive revenue through high-performing Klaviyo campaigns and flows.



Role Overview:



We’re looking for a Klaviyo
 Marketing Expert who can write persuasive copy, use ChatGPT intelligently to speed up ideation and optimization, and run A/B tests that move the needle.



You’ll plan, write, and optimize
 flows and campaigns—turning data into actionable insights and creative improvements. You’ll also collaborate with our Chief Designer to bring your copy and strategy to life visually.



This is a hands-on, creative + analytical role for someone who can think like a strategist, write like a copywriter, and execute like a Klaviyo pro.



What You’ll Do:



Strategize, write, and optimize Klaviyo flows (welcome, abandoned cart, post-purchase, win-back, etc.)



Create campaign calendars and strategies based on client goals, seasonality, and customer behavior



Use ChatGPT to brainstorm copy angles, subject lines, and A/B test variations



Write high-converting
 copy (subject lines, headers, CTAs, and body content) aligned with each brand’s tone



Conduct A/B testing across subject lines, design, copy, and send timing to improve KPIs



Analyze campaign metrics (open rates, CTR, conversion, revenue) and present performance insights



Upload, QA, and schedule campaigns and flows in Klaviyo



Collaborate in Figma to review designs and ensure visuals complement your copy



Continuously refine messaging, segmentation, and flow logic to increase retention and conversions



What We’re Looking For:



Proven experience managing Klaviyo
 marketing for ecommerce brands



Strong copywriting skills with examples of persuasive, conversion-driven
s



Experience using ChatGPT or AI tools to support copywriting and ideation



Data-driven mindset with proven A/B testing experience



Deep understanding of
 strategy, customer journeys, and retention marketing



Technical proficiency in Klaviyo and Shopify



Familiarity with Figma for giving feedback on design



Excellent communication, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple brands



Nice-to-Haves:



Experience writing SMS campaigns in Klaviyo



Basic HTML/CSS for minor troubleshooting



Familiarity with analytics tools like Triple Whale or Google Analytics



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:



Direct impact on client growth and retention



Freedom to test, create, and innovate with AI tools and data insights



Collaborative team environment with design and strategy support



Remote-first and flexible schedule



Clear path for career and income growth in a performance-driven agency



How to Apply:



If you’re passionate about Klaviyo, skilled at writing high-converting copy, and excited to use ChatGPT to level up your strategy—let’s talk.



Please send:



Your resume



3–5 examples of
 copy you’ve written (or screenshots of live Klaviyo campaigns)



A short note on your experience with A/B testing and AI-assisted workflows

title: Inventory Management Assistant
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented Inventory Management Assistant to oversee our end-to-end supply chain operations. You will be the critical link between our design studio and manufacturing partners, ensuring seamless inventory flow from factory floor to customer doorstep.



Key Responsibilities

Inventory Oversight & Reporting

Generate and analyze regular inventory reports to track stock levels, turnover rates, and demand forecasting

Monitor SKU performance and flag slow-moving or at-risk inventory

Maintain real-time visibility across multiple warehouses and fulfillment centers

Factory & Supplier Relations

Serve as primary liaison with overseas manufacturing partners (primarily Chinese-speaking factories)

Communicate production timelines, capacity constraints, and quality standards

Conduct negotiations on pricing, minimum order quantities, and lead times to optimize costs

Procurement & Purchase Orders

Prepare and issue Purchase Orders based on inventory forecasts and sales velocity

Route all POs for internal approval and payment processing

Track order status from placement through delivery, resolving delays proactively

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Partner with design team to align new product launches with inventory planning

Coordinate with logistics on inbound freight and customs clearance

Support finance team with vendor invoice reconciliation



Qualifications

2+ years experience in inventory management, supply chain, or procurement—preferably in furniture, home goods, or consumer products

Business-proficient Mandarin Chinese required for factory negotiations and relationship management

Strong proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets and inventory management software

Excellent negotiation skills with a track record of cost savings

Highly organized with ability to manage multiple SKUs and vendor relationships simultaneously

Experience with international shipping, Incoterms, and import logistics preferred

title: KDP Publishing Virtual Assistant (Canva + Amazon KDP Experience Required)
description:
About the Brand



UnityEd is a professional education brand creating high-end executive planners, documentation logs, and compliance journals for special education teachers and school professionals.



Our products are clean, minimal, and professional — not decorative Etsy-style pintables. We focus on authority, structure, and defensible documentation systems.



We are building a long-term publishing division across:



Amazon KDP (print)



Teachers Pay Teachers (digital)



The Role

We are hiring a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant who has experience creating and uploading journals, planners, and logbooks to Amazon KDP.



You must be comfortable designing professional interiors and covers using Canva and formatting files to KDP specifications.



This is not basic journaling work. We create structured, executive-level tools for professionals.



Responsibilities



Create clean, professional journal interiors in Canva



Design high-end minimalist covers (no decorative fonts)



Format books for Amazon KDP (correct trim sizes, margins, bleed settings)



Upload and optimize listings on Amazon KDP



Conduct basic keyword research on Amazon



Resize files correctly for both platforms



Maintain organized product tracking spreadsheet



Follow brand style guide strictly



Required Skills



Strong Canva experience (advanced level)



Prior experience uploading to Amazon KDP



Understanding of trim sizes (8.5x11, 6x9, bleed vs no bleed)



Strong English writing skills



Excellent attention to detail



Ability to follow structured instructions



Organized file management



Preferred (Not Required but Strongly Valued)



Experience with keyword research tools



Experience creating planners or documentation logs



Understanding of education niche



Design Style Required



Our brand style is:



Minimalist



Executive



Professional



Clean typography



Neutral color palette



Strong white space



Structured layouts



If your portfolio includes:



Corporate planners



Professional journals



Legal-style notebooks



Academic planners



That is ideal.





Deliverables

Per Week:



4–8 completed interiors



4–8 covers



4–8 uploaded listings (KDP)



Updated tracking sheet



Compensation

$5 per hour



Performance-based increases available after 60 days.



Long-term opportunity for the right person.



Trial Task (Required)



Please submit:



A Canva sample page layout for:

“IEP Documentation Log – Interior Page”



A sample minimalist planner cover design



Confirmation you have uploaded to KDP before



Applications without samples will not be reviewed.

title: Senior Next.js/TypeScript Developer for Training SaaS (UI Implementation & Logic Refinement)
description:
About the Project:

We are looking for a skilled Full Stack Developer to jump into an existing, production-grade SaaS application ("Your Safety Partners Portal"). The app is a multi-tenant safety management platform with a focus on Training/LMS features.

We have an existing codebase and a fresh set of designs. We need you to bridge the gap: implement the new UI designs pixel-perfectly and modify the existing logic to support these changes.

The Tech Stack (Must Have):

This is NOT a beginner role. You must be comfortable with:

• Next.js 15 (App Router): We use Server Actions extensively.

• TypeScript (Strict): No any types. We prioritize type safety.

• Styling: Tailwind CSS, Radix UI, and Shadcn UI.

• Database: PostgreSQL with Kysely query builder (connected via Neon).

• State: React Context & React Hook Form (with Zod validation).

What You Will Do:

1. UI/UX Implementation: Take our new designs (Figma/Mockups) and implement them into the existing Next.js application, focusing specifically on the Training & Course Management modules.

2. Logic Modification: Refactor existing Server Actions and Components to match the new workflows. You won't be rewriting the whole app, but you will be modifying how Courses, Modules (SCORM/Documents), and User Assignments work.

3. Clean Code: We follow a "Minimal Abstraction" philosophy. We prefer readable, locatable code over over-engineered patterns. You must be able to read existing code (Middleware, RBAC, etc.) and follow the established patterns.

4. Bug Fixing: identifying and fixing UI regressions or logic errors introduced during the redesign.

Nice to Have (Bonus):

• Experience with SCORM or LMS platforms.

• Experience with Replicache or Local-First sync strategies.

• Experience with file uploads to AWS S3 via presigned URLs.

Who You Are:

• You pay attention to detail. If the design has 16px padding, you don't make it 20px.

• You are comfortable working in a large, existing codebase without breaking unrelated features.

• You communicate clearly and flag issues early.

How to Apply:

To ensure you have read this post, please do the following:

1. Send a message/email with the subject line: "Next.js Training Update - [Your Name]"

2. Include a link to your portfolio or GitHub profile.

3. Answer this specific question in your cover letter: "What is your preferred method for handling form validation in Next.js Server Actions?"

4. Tell me your availability (immediate start preferred).

Note: Generic copy-paste applications will be ignored. We are looking for a human who knows their code.

title: Client Support Specialist
description:
Read Fully Before Applying



We are hiring a Client Support Specialist to manage
 support for a transformational coaching community. This is not a generic support role. Our philosophy is to create raving fans and serve people at a level that feels personal, uplifting, and proactive.



We are looking for someone who is:

 • extremely time-conscious

 • emotionally intelligent and people-first

 • calm, consistent, and dependable

 • proactive in anticipating needs

 • detail-oriented

 • aligned with service and growth environments

This role is about energy and care as much as it is about replies.



Hours & Expectations

• Monday–Friday: 8am–6pm Mountain Time

 • Weekend availability during challenges/events

 •
s must be answered within 1–2 hours

 • Consistency is more important than total time worked

 • This role requires predictable responsiveness

Pay: $500/month

This is not a heavy workload, but it requires reliability and presence.



Administrative Responsibilities

In addition to
 support, this role will include recurring administrative tasks.

• Some tasks will be assigned on an ongoing basis

 • Administrative items must be completed within 12 hours of being assigned or an alternative deadline must be clearly communicated

 • Strong organization and follow-through are required

 • You are responsible for tracking and ensuring completion without reminders



Community Leadership & Engagement Responsibilities

This role also includes ownership of our online community experience.

You will be responsible for:

• Approving and welcoming new members into the community

 • Sending personalized welcome messages

 • Maintaining engagement and meaningful conversation

 • Recognizing wins and celebrating member progress

 • Proactively reaching out to members to build connection and 
ntum

 • Keeping the community informed about company updates, events, calls, and available resources

 • Staying aware of what is happening inside the company and translating that into strategic engagement



Sales & Client Journey Awareness

This role requires sales awareness and ideally previous experience as a sales setter or in a sales-support environment.

You should:

• Understand how to identify buying signals and readiness

 • Feel comfortable initiating private conversations that lead to next steps and setting appointment with a sales coach

 • Know how to move someone from curiosity to commitment

 • Support members in advancing through the client journey

Community engagement directly impacts retention, transformation, and revenue. We expect you to take responsibility for the transformational process and help guide members toward the next level when appropriate.



What Great Support Looks Like Here

Our support should feel:

• transformational and encouraging

 • clear and simple

 • solution-focused

 • anticipatory (thinking ahead for the client)

 • calm and professional

 • human — never robotic

We don’t just answer questions. We guide experiences.



Ownership & Initiative Expectations

This is not a task-based role. This is an ownership role.

The person in this position:

• Takes full responsibility for the client support experience

 • Does not wait to be told what to fix

 • Proactively identifies friction points and improves them

 • Creates systems, templates, and processes without being asked

 • Trains themselves using existing materials and past conversations

 • Brings solutions, not just problems

If something breaks, is unclear, or could be improved, we expect you to flag it and propose a solution.



Continuous Improvement Expectations

Support is part of our growth engine, not separate from it.

We value someone who:

• Tracks recurring questions and improves onboarding to reduce them

 • Notices patterns in client confusion

 • Suggests automation or system improvements

 • Thinks long-term, not just inbox-to-inbox



Growth Opportunity

This role can grow into a Client Experience Manager position for the right person who demonstrates leadership, ownership, and systems thinking.



Culture & Trust

This is a high-trust role.

We value honesty, transparency, and communication. If something is slipping, we want to know early so that solutions can be discussed with the team.



Ideal DISC Profile

High S (steady, supportive, patient)

High C (detail-oriented, reliable, structured)



To Apply — Follow Instructions Exactly



We only review applications that follow directions.



Subject line: “Raving Fan Support – [Your Name]”

In your
, include:

• In 3–5 sentences, explain what great customer service means to you.

 • Tell us one example where you turned an upset customer into a happy one.

 • Give an example of a time when you didn’t know how to respond to a client or were unsure about a task and what you did.

 • Confirm you can maintain 1–2 hour response times during the stated hours.

 • Include the word “Consistency” somewhere in your message.

Please attach a copy of your resume and a link to your OnlineJobs Ph profile. 



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.



If you are dependable, thoughtful, and genuinely care about serving people, this will be a long-term role with growth opportunities.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Our founder is seeking an exceptional Executive Personal Assistant who operates as a true extension of their mind—someone who can see around corners, anticipate needs before they arise, and execute with complete autonomy. This is not a traditional EA role. You will be entrusted with high-stakes decisions across both business and personal domains, acting as the gatekeeper and enabler of the founder's vision.



We are not looking for newbies. Only candidates with 3+ years of relevant experience will be considered.



Core Mandate: Be the Eyes in the Back of Their Head

You will own the invisible infrastructure that keeps the founder operating at peak performance—professionally and personally—without requiring constant direction.



Key Responsibilities

Business Operations & Decision Proxy

Monitor all critical business channels 
, Slack, WhatsApp) and triage with surgical precision—responding on the founder's behalf where authority is delegated

Attend meetings, gather intel, and report back with synthesized insights and recommended actions

Draft communications, negotiate with vendors, and make judgment calls up to a defined threshold

Track open threads across inventory, design, finance, and partnerships; ensure nothing falls through cracks



Personal Life Architecture

Manage complex personal calendar, travel, and household operations with discretion

Handle sensitive personal matters—finances, family logistics, health appointments—treating them with the same rigor as business priorities

Build systems (not just checklists) that prevent problems before they occur



Information & Relationship Management

Be the institutional memory: track commitments, preferences, and ongoing conversations across dozens of relationships

Prepare founder for every interaction with concise, contextual briefings

Filter inbound opportunities, requests, and introductions; only surface what merits attention

Special Projects

Lead ad-hoc initiatives spanning business development, operational improvements, or personal ventures

Research, scope, and execute with minimal oversight—presenting solutions, not problems



Who You Are

Cognitive Profile

Exceptionally high IQ with rapid pattern recognition and systems thinking

Mental juggling ability: you hold 20+ threads simultaneously without dropping one

Autonomous decision-maker: you know when to act, when to ask, and when to escalate

Operational Excellence

Relentlessly organized with a bias toward action and closure

Master of invisible work: everything looks effortless because you've handled the complexity

Discreet to the core; you understand that trust is the currency of this role



Experience Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Minimum 3 years supporting C-suite executives, founders, or high-net-worth principals—preferably in high-growth environments

Proven track record of being entrusted with significant authority and sensitive information

Experience in design, retail, e-commerce, or creative industries preferred

No exceptions on experience. We need someone who has already operated at this level, not someone learning on the job.



What Success Looks Like

Founder never asks "what's the status?" because you've already briefed them

Inbox zero achieved daily without the founder touching

Decisions made on their behalf are indistinguishable from their own choices

You anticipate needs 48-72 hours before they surface

title: Senior WordPress / Shopify Developer (Elementor Pro Specialist)
description:
We are a fast-growing Australian digital marketing agency building premium, high-converting websites for ambitious brands across Australia.



We are looking for a highly skilled Website Developer with strong experience in WordPress (Elementor Pro) and ideally Shopify to join our team long term.



This is not a basic “drag and drop” role.



You will be responsible for bringing professionally designed concepts to life and elevating them with clean execution, smooth interactions, and conversion-focused thinking.



What You’ll Be Doing

- Developing high-end WordPress websites using Elementor Pro

- Implementing designs provided by our designer with precision and attention to detail

- Enhancing designs with thoughtful UI improvements, animations, hover effects, transitions and micro-interactions

- Ensuring pixel-perfect responsiveness across desktop, tablet and mobile

- Optimising site speed and performance

- Occasionally building or editing Shopify themes (bonus skill)

- Testing thoroughly before handover



We want someone who:

- Has strong Elementor Pro experience (required)

- Understands WordPress structure, themes, plugins and performance

- Has experience with Shopify theme customisation (big bonus)

- Thinks critically about user experience and conversion

- Understands visual hierarchy (buttons should stand out, sections should flow, layouts should feel intentional)

- Pays extreme attention to responsive design across all breakpoints

- Writes clean CSS when needed

- Has a good eye for spacing, alignment and consistency

- Is proactive and does not require constant supervision



You must understand what you are building — not just replicate a design blindly. If something feels off, you fix it. If a button needs stronger contrast, you improve it. If movement or interaction would enhance the experience, you suggest it.



To apply, you must:

- Send 3 live Elementor websites you personally built

- Send 1 example of a mobile layout you’re proud of

- Confirm your weekly availability

- Tell us what makes a website “high converting” in 3–5 sentences



Applications without these will not be reviewed.

title: Growth Operations VA (SEO, Ads & Booking Performance)
description:
About the Role



Forbidden Well is hiring a disciplined, execution-focused Growth Operations VA to manage and optimize the systems that directly drive bookings, revenue, and online visibility.



This is not a strategy or creative leadership role. This is a structured execution position with clear KPIs, reporting standards, and measurable performance expectations.



Compensation Structure



Base: $1,000 per month

Performance Bonus: $10 for every qualified booking generated through ForeverBooked ads



This role is performance-driven. The more bookings generated, the more you earn.



Full-time: 40 hours per week

Must be available during New York (EST) business hours.



Core Systems You Will Manage



• Zenoti (CRM, Appointment Booking & Client Management)

• Klaviyo 
 Marketing)

• ForeverBooked (Paid Ads & Lead Follow-Up)

• SearchAtlas (SEO Execution)

• ClickUp (Task & Document Organization)



Primary Responsibilities



Zenoti Management & Booking Operations



• Manage appointment booking, rescheduling, and cancellations inside Zenoti

• Ensure accurate client profiles, notes, tags, and service records

• Monitor daily appointment flow and booking accuracy

• Update services, pricing, and availability as directed

• Track bookings generated from ads and campaigns

• Ensure proper attribution and data accuracy

• Identify and report booking friction or system errors

• Maintain clean, organized CRM records at all times



SEO & Visibility (Primary Focus)

• Execute ongoing SEO strategy using SearchAtlas and Atlas Brain

• Continuously identify and implement opportunities to improve organic rankings

• Optimize content for both traditional search engines and LLM-driven discovery (AI search visibility)

• Publish and refine SearchAtlas-generated content weekly

• Optimize meta titles, descriptions, headings, schema, and on-page structure

• Implement and expand internal linking strategy

• Monitor keyword movement, impressions, crawl health, and page performance

• Improve entity relevance and topical authority for LLM indexing

• Draft weekly Google Business Profile posts

• Provide measurable SEO performance reporting with clear growth metrics



ForeverBooked Ads & Lead Management

• Upload and manage approved ads

• Monitor daily spend, CPL, and lead flow

• Call hot leads within 5–10 minutes of submission

• Qualify leads and book appointments

• Log all outcomes and bookings accurately



Klaviyo
 Execution

• Execute minimum 2 campaigns per week

• Maintain core automated flows

• Perform list segmentation and hygiene

• Track revenue attribution and engagement metrics



Operations & Organization

• Use ClickUp to manage all tasks and documentation

• Organize internal company documents

• QA booking links, forms, and tracking systems



Reporting Requirements (Mandatory)



Daily End-of-Day Report

• Hours worked

• Tasks completed

• Systems used

• Work in progress



Bi-Weekly KPI Report (Before Payroll)

• SEO metrics (keyword movement, impressions, content published)

•
 metrics (campaigns, sends, opens, clicks, revenue)

• Ads metrics (spend, leads, bookings, CPL)

• Total bookings generated

• Summary of results achieved



Performance is measured strictly by data.



Brand Standards



Forbidden Well operates with a defined luxury brand identity.

Strict adherence to brand voice and direction is required.



Strategy remains with the Founder.



Ideal Candidate



• Strong experience with SEO execution tools

• Comfortable making outbound calls to warm leads. American Accent.

• Experienced with Klaviyo and paid ads platforms

• Highly organized and process-driven

• Comfortable working within structured accountability

Expectations

description:
I run a growing online coaching brand helping teachers transition into Amazon FBA entrepreneurship. Our mission is to empower educators to create profitable Amazon businesses and build confidence through faith-forward leadership. We use 
 for funnels,
 marketing, and automation, and we operate an active Amazon FBA business that needs consistent sourcing and backend support.



We’re looking for a highly organized, proactive, tech-savvy Personal Assistant who can manage daily operations, optimize funnels, communicate with suppliers, and help keep the business running smoothly.  



This role is for someone who is detail-oriented, resourceful, and takes initiative.


 Funnel & Marketing Management-Managing, optimizing, and updating the sales funnel infrastructure of our coaching brand. Basic understanding of sales funnels, landing pages, and
 automations.

title: Do you love making people feel cared for? Support our CEOs as an Executive Personal Assistant!
description:
Do you love making people feel cared for? Are you the one who remembers everyone’s birthdays, plans amazing gatherings, makes fun plans, and brings warmth into the lives of those around you?



This is NOT your typical assistant job. It’s deeply personal. You’ll work with a kind but intense U.S.-based pair of brothers (proven entrepreneurs working as Co-CEOs of the same business) to support their lives, not the company they are building. From keeping friendships alive and planning meaningful experiences to sending thoughtful gifts and helping them stay on track with personal goals, you’ll be part organizer, part cheerleader, part coach. If you’ve ever been called the “mom” of your group and you’re looking for a decades-long position, this might be your dream job.



Your Role

- Build trust by executing on tasks and communicating clearly, which will lead to taking on more responsibility, which will then lead to increases in pay.

- Keep relationships thriving by managing a personal CRM and helping stay in touch with friends and family.

- Use technology to help automate certain tasks that are repetitive.

- Track habits, support routines, and act as an accountability partner for personal goals.

- Pick out thoughtful, creative gifts for birthdays and other special 
nts.

- Research products, tools, and ideas to make life easier, better, or more fun.

- Plan and book unforgettable travel, great hotels, and the perfect dinner spots.

- Jump in on special personal projects wherever a helping hand is needed.



What’s In It for You

- A Long-Term Role: This is meant to last. The entrepreneurs who you'd be an assistant to are looking for a lifetime assistant.

- Great Place to Work: These entrepreneurs are known to have a super high retention rate of employees and create a great work environment.

- Creative Work: From planning memorable trips to picking out the perfect gift, this role lets you flex your creative muscles and thoughtful side every day.

- Variety: No two days will feel the same. You’ll get to research, plan, coach, organize, and more.

- Paid Leave: You'll get at least 10 days of paid leave plus major holidays.

- Remote Flexibility: Work from the comfort of your home and gain flexibility with hours once trust is built.



Desired Attributes

- Extremely caring, social people-person who will excel in personal tasks

- High attention to detail and organizational skills

- Very strong written and oral English skills

- Minimum 50 Mbps Internet Speed

- Designated office space in your home



To apply and ensure your application is considered, do all of the following two steps:

1. DM with a quick introduction to yourself if you're interested. Include the word "cupcake" *in your subject line*, and Include your resume. ++Bonus points for a video introduction, though it's not strictly required

2. Fill out this form:

3. Add the Letters "PA" in the "What's your full name" field [E.g. PA - John Doe], so we know what role you are applying for.

title: Strategic Cold Email Specialist - Campaign Optimization & AI Integration
description:
Role overview

We’re hiring a high-agency Virtual Assistant to own end-to-end cold
 fulfillment for boutique, high-value clients. This is a delivery-first role: you will independently build campaigns from client brief ? live campaign ? optimization, own deliverability and technical reliability, and document SOPs so the owner can step away from day-to-day fulfillment.



Key responsibilities

• Full campaign ownership: intake, client research, ICP definition, lead sourcing, copywriting, workflow build, launch, and optimization.

• Lead sourcing & “5 arbitrages”: identify market geography, lead source, generational targeting, personal brand leverage, and timing to find best-fit prospects. Use Sales Navigator, Apify, custom directories, Google Maps, and other sources.

• Build & maintain automation: create 
 (or n8n) workflows that chain scraping ? enrichment ? AI personalization (Claude/GPT) ? Instantly.ai (sending) ? auto-responders. Train prompts/models for consistent tone.

• AI-driven personalization: use Claude/ChatGPT + structured prompts and examples to generate industry-specific, non-AI-sounding copy at scale. Manage prompt engineering and JSON handling inside 
.

• Deliverability & domain management: domain warmup, sender identities, multi-domain A/B testing, bounce mitigation, NeverBounce validation, and troubleshooting flagged domains.

• Monitoring & optimization: daily checks (reply rates, opens, bounce, domain health), weekly optimizations, A/B tests on subject lines/senders/angles, and proactive fixes.

• Auto-responder & qualification flows: configure AI-assisted reply qualification and automated Calendly booking when qualified.

• SOPs & documentation: produce repeatable playbooks (lead sourcing, copy frameworks by vertical, 
 module templates, campaign optimization playbook, troubleshooting guide).

• Client reporting & communication: weekly performance notes, meeting-ready summaries, and ad-hoc troubleshooting updates.



Required qualifications

• Proven experience building and running cold
 / outbound campaigns end-to-end (not just executing parts).

• Hands-on with: 
 (or comparable automation), Apify (or scraping tools), Sales Navigator, Instantly.ai (or Smartlead), NeverBounce, Claude, and ChatGPT.

• Demonstrable ability to write industry-specific, outcome-focused copy (biotech, recruiting, wealth mgmt., logistics, etc.).

• Experience setting up and troubleshooting multi-domain sending, warmups, and deliverability issues.

• Strong prompt engineering & workflow design skills (training models via 
 JSON prompts).

• Highly organized, proactive, and able to own outcomes with minimal oversight.

• Excellent written & spoken English.



Strong preference/pluses

• Agency or startup experience where you built systems from scratch.

• Proven track record of delivering 15–20 qualified intros in 90 days (or similar meeting-intro guarantees) for clients.

• Experience documenting SOPs and running R&D on new tools.

• Comfortable with advanced scraping sources (government filings, conference lists, directories).



Performance expectations & success metrics

• Consistently hit agreed reply/qualification benchmarks.

• Maintain healthy domain metrics and >3% target reply rates.

• Deliver clear SOPs and handover-ready documentation within the first 60–90 days.

• Owner should be able to step away from day-to-day fulfillment after 90 days.



Compensation & benefits

Competitive base pay + performance-based bonuses.

Fully remote with EST schedule.

Professional growth: training, career advancement, and real ownership of fulfillment responsibilities.

Paid Time Off for major U.S. holidays.



If you’re driven, reliable, and interested in being interviewed for this role, please apply directly using the link below, and we’ll move quickly to schedule your initial interview:

title: Web Designer and Developer
description:
Job Title: Web Developer



Role Overview



We are looking for a skilled and creative Web Developer to design, build, and maintain websites and web applications for our organisation. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proficient in modern web technologies, and capable of translating business needs into functional, user-friendly digital solutions.



Key Responsibilities



Front-End Development

 • Develop responsive, mobile-friendly user interfaces.

 • Convert UI/UX designs into functional web pages using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks.

 • Optimise websites for maximum speed, accessibility, and performance.



Back-End Development

 • Build and maintain server-side applications, databases, and APIs.

 • Implement secure authentication, data management, and application logic.

 • Ensure smooth integration between front-end and back-end systems.



Maintenance & Optimization

 • Monitor website performance and troubleshoot issues.

 • Perform regular updates, bug fixes, and feature enhancements.

 • Improve website SEO, loading speed, and user experience.



Collaboration & Communication

 • Work closely with designers, content creators, and the marketing team.

 • Participate in technical planning, sprint meetings, and code reviews.

 • Document code, processes, and technical specifications.



Requirements



Technical Skills

 • Strong knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript.

 • Experience with front-end frameworks such as React, Vue, Angular (specify as needed).

 • Proficiency in back-end technologies such as Node.js, PHP, Python, or Ruby.

 • Experience with databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.).

 • Familiarity with version control (e.g., Git).

 • Understanding of REST APIs, web security, and responsive design.

 • Experience with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress, Webflow) is a plus.



Competencies

 • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

 • Ability to work independently and in a team.

 • Good communication and documentation skills.

 • Attention to detail and a creative approach to web design.

 • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.



Preferred Qualifications

 • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field (preferred but not mandatory).

 • Prior experience developing live web applications or websites.

 • A portfolio or GitHub showcasing previous projects.



Working Hours

 • Standard working hours, with flexibility depending on project deadlines.

 • Remote or onsite work depending on company policy.



Benefits

 • Training and upskilling opportunities.

 • Career progression within the tech team.

 • Supportive, innovative working environment.

 • Project bonuses or performance incentives (if applicable).



Must have project management experience!

title: English Teacher
description:
English Teacher & Call Centre Agent



About Us

We are a growing edtech brand with a network of tuition centres, and we are now entering the next stage of our expansion. As we scale, we are looking for dedicated tea
mbers who can contribute to both our academic delivery and customer experience.



Role Overview



We are seeking a dynamic and versatile individual who can deliver high-quality English lessons while also supporting our customer service operations as a call centre agent. This hybrid role requires excellent communication skills, professionalism, and a genuine passion for education.



Key Responsibilities



1. English Teaching

 • Deliver engaging English lessons to students at the primary, secondary, or adult level based on centre needs.

 • Prepare lesson plans, worksheets, and assessments aligned with the centre’s curriculum.

 • Track student progress and provide constructive feedback to both students and parents.

 • Conduct small group classes or one-to-one tutoring sessions.

 • Foster a positive, motivating, and inclusive learning environment.

 • Support learners in reading, writing, grammar, vocabulary, and exam preparation (e.g., national exams, IELTS, internal assessments).

 • Participate in teacher meetings, professional development sessions, and curriculum updates.



2. Call Centre & Customer Service



 • Handle inbound and outbound calls in a friendly, professional manner.

 • Provide clear information about classes, schedules, fees, and promotions.

 • Follow up with prospective parents and students to support enrolment.

 • Coordinate appointments, placement tests, and trial lessons.

 • Update and manage student records accurately within the system.

 • Address customer enquiries or escalate issues when necessary.

 • Assist with administrative tasks such as attendance tracking, payment reminders, and general enquiries.



Requirements



Qualifications

 • Diploma or Degree in English, Education, Communication, or a related field (preferred).

 • TESOL/TEFL/CELTA certification is an advantage.

 • Previous experience in teaching, tutoring, or customer service is beneficial.



Skills & Competencies



 • Excellent command of written and spoken English.

 • Strong communication skills and professional telephone etiquette.

 • Ability to teach students across different age groups and proficiency levels.

 • Patience, empathy, and effective classroom management skills.

 • Proficient with computers, digital learning platforms, and CRM systems.

 • Strong multitasking and time-management abilities.

 • Positive, proactive attitude with a willingness to learn and adapt.



Working Hours

 • 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM (UK Time)

 • Evening and weekend work may be required depending on class schedules.

 • Call centre duties follow standard centre operating hours.



Benefits

 • Comprehensive training in teaching and customer service.

 • Opportunities for growth within the education brand.

 • Supportive and collaborative team environment.

 • Optional performance incentives or commission based on enrolments.

title: Workflow Dispatch Coordinator
description:
We’re looking for a **Workflow Dispatch Coordinator** who understands the fast-moving world of fleet maintenance and can keep technicians, work orders, customers, and parts workflows running smoothly. This role requires someone who has **hands-on experience working in fleet maintenance or fleet management** and knows the real operational challenges behind keeping commercial vehicles on the road.



You will manage scheduling, technician dispatching, work order movement, parts coordination, and customer communication. If you’ve worked inside a fleet shop, mobile fleet service, or high-volume automotive environment and know how to bring order to constant moving pieces, this role is for you.



---



Why You’ll Want to Join



- Paid in USD twice monthly (15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays based on your location

- 100% remote setup with flexibility to work where you perform best

- Work directly with an operations team supporting fleet technicians across multiple states

- Build systems and structure in a rapidly scaling mobile fleet maintenance company



---



What You’ll Work On



Technician Dispatching and Scheduling



- Assign work orders to technicians based on skill set, location, urgency, and availability

- Ensure technicians are routed and scheduled efficiently to minimize downtime

- Track technician progress throughout the day and adjust assignments as needed

- Monitor high-priority jobs and provide real-time updates to leadership and customers



Work Order and Workflow Management



- Move work orders through their lifecycle from scheduling to completion

- Verify documentation, technician notes, photos, and parts usage

- Ensure all required details are captured to support billing and internal records

- Flag missing information and follow up with technicians to close loops



Customer Coordination



- Communicate job status updates, scheduling adjustments, or technician ETAs

- Work with fleet managers to plan service windows and recurring maintenance

- Provide clear, timely communication around delays, parts issues, or emergencies



Parts and Vendor Coordination



- Collaborate with the Parts Manager on availability, delivery timing, or substitutions

- Monitor whether parts required for upcoming work orders are staged or in transit

- Coordinate with vendors when necessary to ensure technicians have what they need



Operational Tracking and Problem Solving



- Monitor daily workflow dashboards and flag bottlenecks

- Document operational issues and escalate when necessary

- Support the operations team with ad hoc projects that improve efficiency, clarity, and technician productivity



---



What You Bring



- **Must have:** Previous experience in **fleet maintenance or fleet management**

- Ideally **2 to 4 years** of experience in automotive service coordination, dispatching, repair shop operations, or similar

- **Automotive background required** — you should understand vehicle maintenance terms, workflows, and job types

- Comfortable managing multiple moving parts in a fast-paced environment

- Strong communication skills with the ability to speak clearly to technicians, customers, and internal teams

- Highly organized with excellent follow-through

- Tech-comfortable and able to use scheduling software, workflow systems, or fleet management tools



Nice to Have



- Familiarity with tools like **HubSpot, ShopMonkey, Tekmetric, AutoLeap**

- Background supporting multi-state or multi-location service teams

- Familiarity with parts workflows or maintenance planning

- Ability to troubleshoot minor technical issues or documentation gaps



---



How to Apply



Please include:



1. Your **updated resume**

2. A **short 1–2 minute Loom video** explaining your fleet maintenance or dispatch experience and how you manage complex workflows



Only candidates who submit a Loom video will be considered.



---



If you understand the realities of fleet service, enjoy coordinating moving pieces, and can keep technicians and customers aligned throughout the day, this role gives you the chance to support a growing operations team at the center of vehicle uptime and customer trust.

title: Virtual Assistant – Accounting & Data Analyst (Full-Time | Long-Term)
description:
Virtual Assistant – Accounting & Data Analyst (Full-Time | Long-Term)

Company: OnCore Leads

Location: Remote

Schedule: Full-Time (40 hrs/week)

Industry: Performance Marketing & Lead Generation



About Us

OnCore Leads is a fast-growing, data-driven lead generation company serving the home services and legal industries across the U.S. We have been in business for over 12 years and have earned a reputation for reliability, compliance, and performance.

We are looking for a highly detail-oriented Virtual Assistant with a strong background in accounting, bookkeeping, and financial analysis to join our long-term team.



This is not a basic admin role. We need someone who understands numbers, reconciliations, reporting, and financial accuracy.



Your Core Responsibilities



1. Accounting & Bookkeeping

Prepare and send invoices

Reconcile accounts receivable and payable

Perform payment reconciliations

Track incoming/outgoing payments

Monitor discrepancies and resolve issues

Assist with monthly financial reporting

Work with management to ensure financial accuracy



2. Data Analysis & Reporting

Interpret performance reports (calls, leads, revenue)

Identify trends and anomalies in data

Prepare structured reports for account managers

Provide insights on profitability and performance

Maintain organized financial and operational spreadsheets

Assist with forecasting and projections



Requirements

Proven experience in accounting, bookkeeping, or financial analysis

Strong understanding of reconciliations and invoicing

Advanced Excel or Google Sheets skills (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, formulas)

High attention to detail

Strong written English communication

Analytical and structured thinker

Comfortable working with numbers daily

Reliable internet and quiet work environment



Preferred (But Not Required)

Experience with U.S.-based companies

Familiarity with QuickBooks or similar accounting software

Experience analyzing marketing or performance data using Tableau or other similar data visualization software



What We Offer

Long-term, stable position

Competitive pay based on experience

Performance-based increases

Work directly with leadership

Opportunity to grow into a higher-level financial/analyst role

We are building a serious team. We value accuracy, ownership, and accountability.



How to Apply

Please include the following in your application:

Your resume

The word “Reconciled” in the first line of your application (to confirm attention to detail)



If you are highly organized, numbers-driven, and want to be part of a fast-growing company — we want to hear from you.



We are hiring immediately.

title: Patient Care Coordinator
description:
The Patient Care Coordinator (PCC) at NeuStart Psychiatry & TMS is the primary administrative and coordination point of contact for patients. PCCs ensure seamless communication between patients, providers, and clinic operations, enhancing patient experience, operational efficiency, and provider workflow. This role is an evolution of the Healthcare Virtual Assistant (HVA) with increased autonomy, patient-centered focus, and clearly defined responsibilities.



Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Patient Advocacy & Engagement

Respond to all patient communications (portal, Elevate,
) within 4 business hours.

Resolve non-clinical patient concerns or escalate appropriately.

Proactively educate patients on care pathways, including medication refills, lab orders/procedures, and form completion.

Recognize and triage urgent clinical or safety issues following established protocols.



2. Clinical & Provider Coordination

Care Plan Summarization: Generate After Visit Summaries using the live document, outlining discussed care plans, goals, and follow-ups.

Manage provider schedules and patient flow to optimize clinic efficiency.

Draft and prepare documentation: AVS, FMLA, ESA, referrals, treatment letters, prior authorizations.

Ensure chart readiness: all intake forms, labs, and external records are complete prior to appointments.

Serve as intermediary between patients and providers, relaying communications promptly.



3. Administrative Task Management

Send health screeners and virtual meeting links to patients prior to visits.

Initiate and manage prior authorizations, order genetic testing, handle medical records, and coordinate lab/referral orders.

Demonstrate adaptability and flexibility in attending to additional duties assigned by the Lead PCC, including providing coverage for other PCC responsibilities as needed.

Ensure compliance with HIPAA, clinic policies, and ethical standards in all tasks.



4. Operational Excellence & Autonomy

Use standardized communication templates for consistency and compliance.

Track patient requests and unresolved items using workflow tools.

Collaborate with billing, front desk, and leadership for cross-functional patient issues.

PCCs are empowered to own and complete tasks within a clear decision matrix, balancing autonomy with escalation when appropriate.



Qualifications for the Job:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in a healthcare field

HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) certified



Preferred Experience:

Previous employment in healthcare administration or similar roles that involved assisting healthcare professionals.

Proficiency in using virtual platforms, electronic health records (EHR) systems, and other healthcare-related software is important.

Knowledge of healthcare regulations and compliance: Understanding HIPAA regulations and other healthcare compliance requirements is highly desirable. 



Equipment Required:

Desktop/Laptop Computer

Internet



Key Competencies:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact professionally. 

Effective time management skills, capable of prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines consistently.

Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Exhibit reliability by consistently being punctual for both work and meetings.

Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work in a fast-paced environment.

Knowledge of medical terminology and healthcare processes.

Familiarity with platforms such as Cover
ds, GeneSight, and iFax is preferred.

Proven ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality and professionalism.

title: URGENT: FINANCIAL ADVICE ASSOCIATE  - IMPLEMENTATION AND CUSTOMER SUPPORT
description:
LOCATION: Remote

SALARY: AUD$1,500 - AUD $2,500pm (FTE)



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a highly skilled, Australian financial advice firm seeking an experienced, hard-working, and responsible self-starter to support our financial advice clients and enhancing our service:

- implementing financial advice (SOAs)

- assisting with client enquiries & onboarding

- personal insurance research and strategic analysis



ABOUT LIFE UNSHACKLED

LifeUnshackled is a platform built to help people reclaim the life they once dreamed of, clients and team alike. We exist because “retire comfortably” is not the goal, freedom is. We bring bold financial strategy and strong follow-through so clients can build real wealth and live life on their terms. You will be joining a growth-minded team that cares about ambition, high standards, and doing work that genuinely helps people unshackle their lives.



CANDIDATE MUST HAVE:

- An Australian financial planning experience

- Strong compliance knowledge to support product research, data management, onboarding, and implementation tasks.

- Highly skilled with using AI to complete research, synthesise informaiton, generate reports and solve complex problems

- Experience using Google Workspace (Gmail, Google Drive, Docs, and Sheets)

- Especially strong skills at formulas and analysis in Google Sheets / Excel

- A stable and secure internet connection suitable for full-time remote work.

- A reliable computer capable of supporting daily use of cloud-based systems and collaboration tools.

- Clear written communication skills and comfort working with structured templates and prompts.

- A proactive, organised approach and the ability to manage competing priorities.



KEY TRAITS

- Methodical and detail-oriented

- Self-managed with strong follow-through

- Clear communicator

- Collaborative and adaptable across tasks and personalities



WE OFFER

- Training and support from a passionate, purpose-driven team

- Opportunities for long-term growth and stability

- A remote, flexible work environment where your contribution is truly valued



APPLICATION PROCESS

- A 2–5 min video introducing yourself and explaining why you’re the best fit for this role

- Your updated resume and LinkedIn profile link

- Names and contact details of three references (2 professional + 1 personal)



Your answers to the following case study:

**Case Study:**

A client

Long-term growth within a high-performance team

Work that directly impacts client outcomes

title: Paid Ads Specialist (Google / Meta – Execution Focused)
description:

Goal:

Generate consistent, measurable traffic and performance data so we can make informed decisions and scale our advertising efforts responsibly.



About the Role:



We are hiring a Paid Ads Specialist to manage and optimize paid advertising campaigns for our e-commerce business.



This role is focused on traffic acquisition, budget control, and performance tracking. You will be responsible for setting up, running, and optimizing paid ad campaigns to drive qualified traffic and measurable results.



This position is best suited for someone who prefers clear scope, data-driven execution, and measurable outcomes.



Primary Responsibilities:



- Set up, manage, and optimize paid ad campaigns on:

- Google Ads (Search, Shopping, Performance Max)

- Meta Ads 
 / Instagram), if applicable

- Track and report on key performance metrics, including: ROAS, CPA, CTR, CPC

- Identify top-performing products, keywords, and audiences

- Optimize campaigns based on performance data

- Provide clear, structured performance reports on a weekly basis



What This Job Is NOT:



- No website development or theme editing

- No Shopify backend access required

- No content writing or graphic design

- No social media posting or community management

- No branding or creative direction

This is a paid advertising execution role.



Required Skills:



- Proven experience managing Google Ads and/or Meta Ads

- Experience running ads for e-commerce products

- Strong understanding of paid advertising metrics and optimization

- Ability to manage budgets carefully and prevent overspending

- Comfortable starting with test budgets and scaling responsibly

- Clear communication and reporting skills

- Reliable availability and follow-through



Nice to Have (Not Required)



- Experience advertising physical products (home improvments)

Work Expectations

- Willingness to pause or adjust campaigns based on results

- Long-term, stable working relationship preferred

- Collaborate with developer and designer by providing clear performance feedback and requirements related to paid advertising

- Available during US business hours to respond to urgent or time-sensitive issues affecting live campaigns

To Apply, Please Answer:

title: Executive Assistant and Sales Right Hand to CEO
description:
Executive Assistant and Sales Right Hand to CEO

Proactive. Relentless Follow-Through. Trusted Partner.



We run multiple companies in the legal and financial services space. The mission is simple, help business owners succeed and build companies they can actually sell. The founder is a lawyer and finance guy by training, but you would never guess it. He is approachable, down to earth, and focused on results without the fluff, fake polish, or corporate nonsense.



This role is about being his right hand. You will protect his time, keep priorities straight, and make sure nothing important is forgotten. You will handle the calendar and inbox, but even more critical, you will manage follow-ups with referral partners, prospective customers, and key relationships so 
ntum never dies.



A normal day means filtering the inbox and calendar so the noise disappears and the right meetings get scheduled. You will sit in on calls or catch the notes, then turn them into clear follow-ups that live in the CRM and stay alive until complete. You will act as the founder’s second brain when it comes to high-value referral partners, prospects, and customers. You will nudge, remind, and track so relationships don’t fade and opportunities don’t slip. Communication will flow through Slack, where you will capture ideas, tasks, and follow-ups before they vanish.



You will keep a close eye on the sales pipeline. We already have systems for the routine stuff, but your focus will be on the high-value opportunities where personal attention is everything. Ahead of meetings, you will pull quick research on people and companies so the founder shows up sharp. You will also work with tea
mbers, contractors, and vendors to keep important projects moving forward.



This role is for someone who is proactive, structured, and relentless about follow-through. You thrive in a support role where success means the CEO never has to wonder whether something got done. You are comfortable with modern tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and CRMs, but you do not need to be a tech wizard.



This is not for someone who waits for instructions or hesitates to speak up. It is not for someone who only wants to be told what to do instead of acting as a true partner.



This is a full-time remote role. Ideal candidates are based in the Philippines with overlap in Mountain Time. Pay is based on experience, with bonus potential tied to performance. The founder is a foodie and loves cooking meals from scratch, so when you respond, tell us your favorite thing to eat. If you don’t answer that, you will not be considered. You will work directly with the founder as his right hand, making sure that every commitment, relationship, and opportunity gets the follow-through it deserves.

title: Executive Virtual Assistant
description:
We are seeking a highly organised, proactive, and technologically fluent Virtual Executive Assistant to support two busy professionals across their clinical, academic, business, and household responsibilities. This role requires someone who can confidently manage complex schedules, coordinate childcare logistics, streamline administrative workflows, and progressively take on higher?level business administration tasks.

A key component of this role is providing robust administrative support for both careers, including academic scheduling, professional documentation, inbox management, and—over time—upskilling into administrative support for a small company, including billing, bookkeeping, and liaison with accountants.

The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic environment, anticipates needs, and uses AI tools to automate and optimise workflows.



Key Responsibilities

1. Executive & Administrative Support

- Manage and triage shared and individual
 inboxes.

- Coordinate clinical, academic, and professional calendars, ensuring seamless integration with household logistics.

- Prepare, track, and submit:

- Salary packaging documentation

- Continuing professional development claims

- Professional development paperwork

- Receipts and compliance documentation

- Support academic and non?clinical commitments, including:

- Maintaining a weekly schedule of research, administration, and project work.

- Ensuring protected time is allocated prior to key meetings and governance responsibilities.

- Manage recurring accommodation bookings and related travel logistics.



2. Business Administration & Financial Operations (desired)

The role includes progressive responsibility for business administration, including:

- Bookkeeping: maintaining accurate financial records, categorising expenses, and preparing summaries.

- Liaising with accountants: coordinating documentation, responding to queries, and ensuring compliance.

- Supporting a small property?related business, including:

- Document preparation

- Expense tracking

- Communication with external stakeholders

- Preparing and submitting relevant tax exemption applications and maintaining associated records.

Training and upskilling will be supported, with the expectation of increasing autonomy over time.



3. Rostering & Weekly Logistics

- Build and maintain the childcare roster, ensuring:

- Alignment with clinical and academic work hours.

- Consideration of variable availability of both professionals.

- Childcare provider hours average 30 hours/week over a month (20–40 acceptable).

- Arrange additional support if schedules clash.



4. Household Operations & Meal Planning

- Develop weekly meal plans for:

- Dinners and lunches for the household and live?in childcare provider.

- Children’s lunches and snacks

- Create shopping lists and coordinate grocery orders.

- Hire and manage a gardener, including lawn repair and general maintenance.

- assist with ad hoc need for trades or repairs



5. Children’s Commitments & Family Events

- Manage children’s schedules, including:

- appointments such as dentist, health care providers

- extra-curricular activity coordination.

- school communications

- Birthday party RSVPs.

- Gift purchasing

- assist with project management of children’s birthday parties.

- Organise date nights, weekends away, and family holidays, including itinerary planning and travel bookings.



6. AI?Enhanced Productivity & Automation

The ideal candidate will confidently use AI tools to:

- Automate recurring tasks (e.g., meal planning, inbox triage, reminders, document drafting).

- Optimise rostering and scheduling using AI?assisted calendar logic.

- Draft
s, summaries, and documents with high accuracy.

- Create templates, checklists, and workflows that reduce manual effort.

- Support research, compare options, and generate recommendations.

- Maintain structured knowledge bases (e.g., Notion, OneNote, or similar).

- Identify opportunities to streamline operations using AI?driven solutions.



Key Skills & Attributes

- Strong administrative capability, with the ability to support two demanding professional careers.

- High proficiency with AI tools and digital productivity platforms.

- Ability to manage complex, multi?layered schedules with competing priorities.

- Excellent written and verbal communication.

- High level of discretion and confidentiality.

- Experience with bookkeeping or willingness to upskill quickly.

- Proactive problem?solver with excellent judgment.

- Comfortable coordinating childcare logistics and household operations.

- Ability to work independently and anticipate needs.

- Takes initiative and asks for help/assistance when needed



What Success Looks Like

- Professional administrative needs are handled smoothly and proactively.

- Business administration becomes increasingly efficient as the assistant upskills.

- The weekly roster runs predictably, with childcare, exercise, and work commitments aligned.

- Academic and governance obligations are consistently met without last?minute pressure.

- Household operations feel seamless, with meals planned, shopping organised, and commitments tracked.

- AI tools are used intelligently to reduce friction, automate tasks, and create clarity.

- The household experiences more ease, time, and headspace.



Time commitment: 20 hours per week, can be flexible with scheduling as minimal face-to face contact, most communication will be through whatsapp and
.

As we continue to expand our global footprint, we are seeking experienced Overseas Consultants with strong expertise in government relations, and a deep understanding of political affairs, economics, law, and public policy.



Scope of Work and Responsibilities  

Consultants in this role primarily support research, policy analysis, and advisory work related to overseas political, regulatory, and governance developments. Typical tasks include:



Conducting background research and policy monitoring



Stakeholder mapping and engagement analysis



Drafting analytical briefs and memos



Supporting scenario planning and risk assessments for client decision-making



Types of Clients and Projects  

Our clients generally include private enterprises, professional institutions, and organizations with cross-border interests that require an informed understanding of overseas political, regulatory, or public-sector environments. Projects are research- and analysis-driven, and may relate to:



Public policy trends



Government processes



Geopolitical risk assessments



Work Structure (approximately 20 hours per week)  

This is a flexible, part-time consultancy arrangement. Work is typically project-based, with weekly hours varying depending on deliverables and timelines. Coordination is conducted remotely, and schedules are discussed in advance to align with both project requirements and consultant availability.



Preferred Backgrounds  

Candidates with prior experience in the following sectors will be given priority consideration:



Government or public administration



Law firms or legal advisory institutions



Media or strategic communications organizations



Think tanks or research institutions



Consulting or public relations firms



Non-governmental or international organizations



Compensation and Benefits  

We offer competitive compensation packages and flexible work arrangements tailored to global professionals.



Application  

For inquiries or application submission, please contact us at:





Or visit our website:

title: GoHighLevel (GHL) Automation & CRM Specialist
description:
Looking for a GoHighLevel specialist who can turn automation into a reliable growth system, not just someone who builds basic funnels.



If you enjoy organizing messy pipelines, building smart workflows, and improving conversion processes, this role may be a strong fit.



Key Responsibilities

- Build and optimize funnels (lead generation, sales, booking, memberships)

- Create advanced workflows for nurturing, follow-ups, onboarding, and reactivation

- Structure and manage CRM pipelines, tags, triggers, and custom fields

- Integrate GHL with tools like Zapier, Stripe, Calendly, SMS and
 providers

- Monitor funnel and campaign performance and recommend improvements

- Troubleshoot automation, tagging, and delivery issues

- Document systems clearly for team reference

- Stay updated with GHL feature releases and automation best practices



This role focuses on building systems that drive consistent results.



Required Qualifications

- 2+ years of hands-on GoHighLevel experience

- Strong background in workflows, triggers, campaigns, and funnel logic

- Clear understanding of CRM automation strategy

- Experience with third-party integrations and API connections

- Able to explain system logic and decision-making

- Can show measurable results from previous builds

- Strong communication and documentation skills



Nice to Have

- Experience building membership sites or courses inside GHL

- Knowledge of SMS and
 compliance standards

- Experience working with agencies or scaling businesses

- Basic understanding of conversion-focused messaging



How to Apply

To be considered, please include:

- A short summary (3–5 sentences) of a GHL system you built

- The problem it solved

- One measurable result achieved

- Your expected hourly or monthly rate



Applications without these details will not be reviewed.
