In the subject line, write:

Creative Designer – Blue

title: Google Ads/PPC Manager
description:
Job description:

About LionHead Digital:

LionHead Digital is a leading digital marketing agency that helps criminal defense, personal injury, and family law firms grow through advanced SEO, Local SEO, Local Service Ads, Google paid ads, custom web design, and AI-powered intake systems. For more than 9 years, we have supported law firms across the United States with a full suite of digital marketing services that are built to drive real cases and measurable revenue.

We operate like an internal marketing department for our clients, tracking every lead, reporting verified leads each month, and showing firms exactly which leads turned into qualified cases. This focus on transparency, accountability, and signed case reporting sets us apart from typical agencies.

Our vision is to become the most elite and trusted law firm digital marketing partner in the United States, serving one thousand law firms within the next decade.



Role Overview

The Google / PPC Ads Manager owns the end-to-end strategy, execution, optimization, and performance of paid media campaigns (primarily Google Ads, but may include other PPC platforms as defined).

This role is responsible for turning approved strategy and budgets into qualified leads, controlled CPLs, and scalable results, while maintaining clear communication with Operations, Client Success, and leadership.

This is a performance-driven, data-heavy role that sits between Strategy, Fulfillment, and Client Success.



Primary Objective

Drive consistent, profitable lead generation through well-structured, optimized PPC campaigns while maintaining accuracy, transparency, and accountability in reporting and execution.



Core Responsibilities

1. Campaign Strategy & Setup

Own PPC strategy once a client is marked Fulfillment-Ready

Review client goals, market, budget, and signed scope

Build campaign structure aligned with services, locations, and intent

Set up campaigns, ad groups, keywords, conversion tracking and events, bidding strategies and budgets, ensure campaigns are compliant with platform and industry policies

2. Account & Asset Validation

Validate access to:

Google Ads account

Google Analytics / GA4

Conversion tracking (GTM, website, forms, calls)

Review landing pages for relevance, clarity, and conversion readiness

Flag missing assets, tracking gaps, or structural issues before launch

Coordinate fixes with Dev, SEO, or Ops as needed

3. Campaign Launch & Optimization

Launch campaigns based on approved timelines

Monitor performance daily during early launch phase

Optimize keywords and match types, Ad copy and extensions, budgets and bids, search terms and negative keywords, ensure CPL, lead quality, and spend pacing remain within targets

4. Performance Monitoring & Reporting

Track and analyze key PPC metrics:

Spend, CPL, conversions, CTR, Quality Score

Maintain accurate reporting dashboards and notes

Flag underperformance early with a clear action plan

5. Cross-Team Coordination

Work closely with CSMs for client context and feedback, SEO / Content for keyword alignment and messaging, Web / Dev for landing page improvements, Operations for capacity and prioritization

Ensure changes are documented and aligned with client expectations

6. Process Adherence & Improvement

Follow documented PPC SOPs and playbooks

Maintain clean account structure and naming conventions

Identify recurring issues (tracking, approvals, lead quality, budget limits)

Propose improvements to campaign frameworks, QA checklists, Reporting templates, Automation and rules

7. Internal Marketing

Plan, launch, and optimize Internal Google Ads / PPC campaigns (lead generation, hiring, offers, brand initiatives)

Align internal campaign goals with leadership and Operations

Manage budgets, tracking, and performance reporting for internal campaigns

Apply learnings from client campaigns to improve LionHead’s paid media strategy

Ensure internal campaigns follow the same QA, tracking, and optimization standards as client work



Key Success Metrics:

Cost Per Lead (CPL) vs target

Lead volume consistency

Conversion tracking accuracy (zero broken tracking)

% of campaigns launched on time

Reduction in wasted spend (irrelevant search terms)

Client satisfaction related to paid media performance

Performance of internal PPC campaigns (CPL, conversions, spend efficiency)

Consistency and accuracy of tracking for internal campaigns

Key Expectations

Performance Ownership & Accountability:

Take full ownership of PPC performance, ensuring campaigns consistently meet or exceed agreed CPL, lead volume, and quality targets.

Data-Driven Decision Making:

Make optimization and scaling decisions based on performance data from Google Ads, GA4, conversion tracking, and CRM feedback—not assumptions.

Strategic Execution:

Design and manage scalable, intent-driven campaign structures aligned with client goals, budgets, and market realities.

Clear Communication & Reporting:

Communicate performance insights, risks, and action plans clearly to Client Success, Operations, and leadership.

Results-Oriented Mindset:

Focus on measurable outcomes that directly impact lead quality, client retention, and revenue growth.

Autonomy & Ownership:

Operate independently with strong judgment, proactively identifying issues and opportunities without needing constant oversight.



Requirements

3-5+ years of hands-on Google Ads / PPC management experience (agency or in-house).

Proven experience managing multiple accounts with measurable performance results.

Deep expertise in Google Ads campaign structure, bidding strategies, keywords, match types, and Quality Score optimization.

Strong understanding of conversion tracking, GA4, GTM, call tracking, and CRM attribution.

Experience managing budgets responsibly and optimizing spend efficiency.

Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and translate insights into clear actions.

Strong communication and documentation skills.

Experience working cross-functionally with SEO, Web, Content, and Client Success teams.

Ability to stay current with PPC platform updates, policy changes, and best practices.



Benefits & Perks:

Competitive Compensation: Attractive base salary with quarterly and end-of-year performance bonuses

Generous PTO: Paid time off and holidays for a great work-life balance.

Employee Recognition Programs:

Employee of the Month Award with incentives.

Employee of the Year Award - winner receives an all-expenses-paid vacation for themselves and their family.

Team Culture: Supportive, high-performance team that values results, efficiency, and continuous learning.

Impactful Work: Your strategies will directly contribute to law firm success, and your contributions will be valued and rewarded.



Next Steps:

1. TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE PLEASE COMPLETE BOTH BEHAVIORAL & COGNITIVE ASSESSMENTS (The Cognitive assessment will be
ed immediately upon completion of the Behavioral assessment: 

2. Please submit a 2 to 3 minute introduction video telling us who you are, where you’re based, your relevant skills and experience, your career goals, and why you’re interested in this role and believe you’re a strong fit. Please add the link here.

3. Send your application here:
